description:
Loved this place. What a tap list! I've spent three days in this town looking for a decent Porter on tap and finally found one. We just stumbled on it, too, after eating dinner across the street.

The pinball machines are a nice touch, too. Some good throwback titles. 

Definitely worth stopping in if you have a chance.
author: Brian S.

description:
Well this bar is no longer worth the time or money. If you fire bartenders because they don't look like the new Mission, then your bar sucks a big fat one. I personally don't like the bar because the new, frat boy obviously amateur management knows not what it does.

Go back to where you came from, bruh.
author: Jan S.

description:
I was excited to find another German spot in the Mission, but this is more of a bar. My boyfriend likes their beer options, but they have limited food options. 

* Pretzel - 2 stars
Not fresh. I'm pretty sure this was microwaved. This was way too hot when came out. It also came with a weird fake-looking, but spicy, mustard dip.

* Bratwurst - 2.5 stars
Not great, bread pretty stale, not very memorable.
author: Ziyan C.

description: This place has gone way way way down hill. They used to have very reasonably priced beers reasonably priced pinball and opened in the day with some of the best sandwiches that San Francisco had to offer. Now they open later, charge too much  got rid of the sandwiches and it's overrun with techholes. I mean they even got rid of the happy hour for Christ's sake. That just says it all right there there is no happy hour here anymore. Stopped in for a game of pinball and one overpriced microbrew then leave
author: Jeremy R.

description: I am heartbroken to discover that one of my favorite bars has just fired its heart & soul. Shame on you, Gestalt. There is nothing good about this shallow new image you are trying to portray.
author: Christa H.

description: WTF is up with the Nuevo and idle rich moving in on our fair city, San Francisco? How far gone is our culture? This used to be the city of free love and magical elephants only visible to the keen eye. When was the last time you saw your dreams at your fingertips and available for the taking in our less than fair city? Earthquake weather?!? Please. Bring it. Another SF girl was fired today for not representing the current climate in the Mission. Her hair not blond and tattoos not covering enough of her skin has deemed her below the hiring line. She's been fired for not being male and Aryan. This constitutes sexual and racial prejudice. Flag this place and all who enter. Down with the Nazi-snakes and SS conspirators. Gestalt is far less than the sum of its parts. Suck dick and smoke crack Dan!
author: J L.

description: This used to be one of my favorite bars in the mission,  but it's just another yuppie bad overpriced place now.  I would avoid and try any other bar in the area.
author: Olga S.

description: Well this is a nice little bar that I had not known about or ever been to until today. I was walking from Valencia and 16th to Dolores Park and happened upon this. Outside it said they had sandwiches for sale and I needed some late lunch. The sandwiches were a little overpriced, so I went with a sausage on roll with sauerkraut. I had the smoked bratwurst. It was $7 flat. I like any bar with decent food as opposed to no food, so sausages and sandwiches are nice offerings here. This is a dive bar. The people in it at the time were not hipsters. The bartender/host was reading Chelsea Girls by Eileen Myles. Cool.
author: Denise C.

description: I can get lost looking at the beer menu at this place. But I always ask whatever oatmeal stout they have on tap. The bartender even let me have a small sample in a shot glass. Tasted hella good to me. They have a few TVs playing sports and the couple of times I've been here, they always have the Warriors game on. They have nice music playing in the background, but yet it's just that. You can have a conversation without having to yell. Oh yeah, they have pinball machines too.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
Periodic review #4.  Pinball has grown and there's always 10 machines here and luckily Rainbow has put in a solid state on a rotating basis.  Right now it's Taxi, a great machine from 1988 or 1989 I think!  

Justin the manager is awesome and helps to make sure that the machines are in good shape and their rotating beers on tap are usually a pretty nice mix of styles.

Play in the SF Super Selfie Pinball League or check out the championship cup from the Bay Bridge Pinball League of which Gestalt hosts two teams including the defending champions (TBD!!!!!!!!!) as well as my team, the Mission Flipsters...
author: Gene X.

description:
10/10 would come here every day to play pinball if I could.

The best part was playing the KISS pinball machine for half an hour than sitting at my desk the next day humming "Detroit Rock City."
author: Lauren G.

description:
Surprisingly good watering hole with so many things going for it, whether a gigantic beer selection, decent food offerings including sandwiches and sausages, and enough room to spread out and socialize, whether you're part of a large group or want to hunker down over some pinball. And even when it gets super crowded here, service is generally fast, attentive, and friendly. What's more, the location - just steps from BART - couldn't be better.

A great all-around venue that gets the job done.
author: Vincent L.

description: This is an amazing place! AND THEY ALLOW (encourage) DOGS INSIDE! Super friendly and dog-loving bartender. Stop everything and go here!
author: Ebi M.

description: A year later and I finally remembered to come back and try the vegan sausages at Gestalt Haus.  Brought my friends here on a Sunday afternoon for some fuel to keep going strong on our day drinking, football watching Sunday in the mission.  We came around 4PM on a Sunday and found the place to be less than half full, which was fine because we got great seats right by the TVs and excellent, quick service.  I grabbed an IPA on draft and the vegan apple sage sausage.  Topped with sauerkraut, perfectly cooked and I added some of the serve yourself condiments from the sidebar (spicy ketchup and Dijon mustard). Holy Yum. I had to stop myself from doublin' down and getting another sausage this thing was so delicious and packed with flavor.  Would totally come back here again to try the other variety, and of course, always enjoy the fantastic draft/bottle selection this spot provides. Cheers.
author: Kelsey B.

description: Just come and check this out. Beer, food & TV screens - oh yes, lots of pinball machines in case beer ain't enough 4u!
author: Bessie T.

description: This place has everything you want in a bar: wide selection of great draft beers and great food.  Plus they are dog friendly!  My go to spot in the Mission
author: Paul R.

description: This place is a home away from home for two aging hipsters a from Philly. Chill vibe and great happy hour.
author: Sunny R.

description:
Yes. All the yes.

Low key bar, great sausages, all the beer, and arcade machines. I'm not sure there's much else you need, right?

I can see this being a regular spot to grab a bite before going to the cinema. Top spot.
author: Rowena H.

description: They have some pretty awesome pinball machines here. The music selection was also good. I can't say much for the food or the drinks.
author: Amy J.

description: Minus the female waitress who initially wouldn't give change of ten dollars for a thirty dollar order because she should get tipped, great sandwiches and really good beer. No frills dive bar. All cash.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
There's lots of fun dive bars in the Mission.  So why should you go to Gestalt Haus?  Two reasons.....The Staff and The Food!  The sausage's and brat's are top notch with great brews on Tap.  They aren't a 'full bar' but for me I just pace myself better during games having only beer.
Will I be back?  Heck ya!
Thanks Gestalt Haus!
author: Jim P.

description:
Fairly chill bar in the mission

Most bars in the area has a hipster vibe, and this place is no exception! Pinball machines, retro lamps, graffiti on the walls are all part of the decor. The crowd is also young and somewhat hipster, but in general the place is fairly open. The doors are wide open, and it certainly feels like anyone walking by can just swing in for a quick drink. The waitstaff is pretty friendly as well.

A good place to swing by whenever happen to walk by.
author: Henry L.

description: Huge variety of beer on tap. They let you samole beer before you order it! Great atmosphere and they have pinball machines
author: Sujen S.

description:
I actually wasn't planning on coming to Gestalt Haus.  Monk's Kettle down the street was opening up later than their usual time and I had 30 minutes to kill.  So I kept walking and I saw Gestalt Haus was the closest bar.  

I walked in and saw that pinball, pinball, pinball and a fair amount of people in here at 5pm.  Got to the bar and saw lots of taps, no hard alcohol, and a guy behind the bar pretty much doing everything.  Although I thought it would mostly be all Euro beers like Belgians and Dunkel-type stuff but I saw a milk stout on tap and I usually can't say no to milk stouts.

I think they also have food here like sausages with kraut as food but judging by the looks of this place and the lack of a kitchen, I don't see who or how they can cook that food.  For a good beer when the other places around here are too full...

Side entertainment notes:  during my half hour, I did witness one guest who was refusing to leave when told to.  I saw some loud voices that I couldn't hear(music was loud here) and at some point, I saw shoving, more talking, and he eventually left...the potential Jerry Springer moment was avoided.
author: Ben H L.

description: Seriously.  Dive bar with fantastic food, service, customers and beer.  Hands down the best experience I had in San Fran.  Cash only
author: Lisa H.

description: They asked everyone to leave at 1:40 am. Some people were still drinking beer and we're encouraged to excessively drink finish their remaining beer. That is irresponsible.  When I asked the bartender why they didn't give us a warning she told us to wait across the street. NEVER will I ever visit again.
author: Mary E.

description: The beer is awesome however we asked local bartenders where to head to and they suggested this bar for their food, beer, and pinball. Upon their wall they say "sausages and pretzels all night" however we were there at 2330 and the bartender said she already turned off the oven..
author: Katie T.

description:
I've been here twice, each on different visits to San Francisco.

It's one of the jewels of Mission District's elaborate chain of bars. Friendly and chill servers, self-serve water, big roomy tables, and it's very clean. This place primarily specializes in beer and has a pretty decent selection. I really like that they have Hitachino, Japanese craft bottles here. Gestalt Haus's thing is that they're also an arcade bar, so there are pinball machines inside. I haven't played them so I can't comment too much on that. But as with everything else in the bar, it's well-kept.

The vibe of the people in the bar is intellectual, jovial, and classy. A man came up to me when I was waiting for my friend and asked if he could sit at my table and just talk. We had a conversation and he told me about himself, and then politely wished me good luck on my vacation and left after he finished his beer. Didn't ask for my number or anything. A pleasant surprise.

For food, I got their vegan hotdog and frankly, I was a little underwhelmed. But I don't really go to bars for the food anyway.

Gestalt is solid for a guaranteed good time.
author: Amy F.

description: Good place for a beer, got some fun games but also quiet enough to grab a table and catch up with friends. I do enjoy starting the evening here!
author: Yvonne C.

description:
Came here with some girlfriends around New Years Day.  Nice little dive bar in the Mission.  Their beer selection isn't as crazy extensive as other places but it has a little bit of everything to satisfy a wide variety of tastes.

The staff here was awesome.  I ordered a hef and I like to enjoy it with a slice of orange or lemon.  When I requested the bartender said he didn't have any.  I was a little disappointed, but what can yah do?  The bartender had an answer!  He pulled out some cash, RAN over to the market nearby bought an orange, ran back to bar, cut up the orange, and gave me a slice for my drink and then another third of the orange just so I could have more orange.  Granted, the bar wasn't crazy busy, but it's gestures like that that makes a customer's day/night.  Thank you bartender, you are awesome.  Next time I'm in SF, I hope you're there when I visit.  :)
author: Sola L.

description: Although I'm not the target audience for this bar (I don't like beer or pinball), it was nonetheless pleasant.  They had strong cider on tap, the bratwurst (though small) was tasty, and (when I was there) it wasn't too loud for conversation.
author: Ben D.

description:
This is one of my favorite local bars. They have an awesome selection of beer and really delicious food. 

Warning: it's beer and wine only no hard booze

Food - they have delicious sandwiches and amazing sausages. The sausages are out if this world and they have several different sausages and toppings that you can choose from. All are delicious. They also have regular and spicy ketchup and mustard which is awesome. The sandwiches are all huge and delicious and legitimately give Ike's competition. The Dre Dog and the Charlie Sheen are my favorites.

Service - always amazing. The nicest people in the world work here.

Drinks - they have REALLY good beer here and they have new beers on tap all of the time. Some of them are ridiculously strong so beware. The wine is ok, just basic bar wine. They do have mimosas which is nice for the weekends. 

Ambiance - amazing. They have air conditioning first of all. This might not sound like a big deal but last summer when it was ridiculously hot I discovered this is the ONLY restaurant/bar in the entire Mission with air conditioning. I basically moved here because my apartment was literally 110 degrees for like a month. They also have wifi and tables with plugs which is genius so you can charge your phone or plug your computer in and work/study a bit while you enjoy a beer. A lot of locals hang out here and do that so its not strange if you bring your computer. 

Music - they have a DJ booth but there's never a DJ 

They also have a bunch of pinball machines that are fun to play. I've seen pinball gurus travel here to play the machines. 

Overall great, casual, typical Mission spot.
author: Juliet S.

description:
CASH ONLY. Now that I've sorted out people who will not come with people who will, let's get started. Chill vibes come from this place. It specializes in German beer and bar snacks such as soft pretzels. Came here with some friends on a Saturday night. 

The bouncer there recognizes faces. Even if you step out he will just let you back in, no need to re-check IDs every single time, especially if you are standing right in front of him outside the bar. One of my pet peeves is re-checking IDs when I'm literally right in front of you.

Now most people want the DAS BOOT. I know I did. It will cost you $30 as a down payment in case you get any ideas about leaving with the sweet glass boot. It's also $30 to fill the beer. So you need at least $60 cash in your pocket if you're thinking of doing that. 

Beer selection is nice and I'm glad I could get what I was looking for. You would think the inside would remind you of Oktoberfest but it's more of a modern take. Music is hip hop instead of Bavarian folk tunes. Sports on the TVs. I really wanted someone in leiderhosen with an accordion walking around.

It's a chill place to get the party started if you're thinking about bar hopping.
author: Jeromy G.

description:
This place is actually really cool. We only wandered in because a friend wanted to grab a drink, and Monk's Kettle is, alas, not a casual drink sort of place, so in we walked.

The inside is nice and dark and a little divey, with a nice hipster touch of indoor bike parking, arcade games, and a "you're beautiful and don't need a mirror to proove that"-heavily graffitied bathroom.

BEER SELECTION.
Impressive, to say the least. They're all listed on a huge chalkboard on the wall with at least 30+ different (good) beers, hand-written neatly and erased as they run out. They also have the coolest selection of tap handles that I've eve seen, and the fact that they carry a Monty Python beer (which is delicious, by the way), is freaking cool.

FOOD.
Alas, I was too full to try anything, but let me tell you - everything is 100% legit. Their sandwiches are loaded with fresh meats and cheeses, their sausages are huge (get your minds out of the gutter, people), and everything is super reasonably priced.

Their one flaw? CASH ONLY.
author: Claire S.

description:
Excellent selection of beer and vegan sausages. I don't know why there aren't more really good beer places in SF with vegan options. We all know vegans love eating, especially drunk vegans. Give me all the vegan bratwurst and all the IPAs.

Oh and there are pinball machines!
author: Jon T.

description:
You'd be surprised that there isn't just one awesome sausage bar in the city. No, there's at least two. Not to disparge the others, but Gestalt (so far) has blown away the others I've gone to. Between the types of sausage, vegan options, pretzels and cheese sauce appetizers and beers as far as the eye can see, there's definitely something for everyone here. Well, if you're interested in pub food and alcohol that is. 

We came in for lunch and each had a sausage on a bun (made our own way), with a side order of a pretzel with cheese sauce, plus a beer and adult root beer for drinks. The price for our food was reasonable and we had more than enough to eat with what we ordered. The restaurant was pretty empty and quiet when we went in and the bartender who took our order and brought out the food was super friendly.

I would have to say that Gestalt might be my preferred sausage-serving restaurant at this point. Two thumbs, five stars, many butt-pats.
author: Cassandra J.

description:
This is a good, solid, dependable place for a fun time with friends. There are long tables at the entrance for larger groups, smaller tables deeper into the bar, and of course seats at the actual bar. They have such a large selection of beer! You cannot miss the huge wall listing their currently choices (even though I totally did) and they even have bottles of champagne for $15. My friend and I totally started out night with a bottle of champagne... no shame.

Pretty relaxing environment with pinball machines and couches. The only downside is that the bartenders are like... going through a mid-life crisis or something. It's like they don't even want to be there. I thought it was just the one time I went, but I read other Yelp reviews and it seems to be a trend. Hire some friendlier people, please. Then again if you are just going to enjoy a few beers and catch up with friends, maybe it doesn't matter much to you.
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Totally mind-boggling selection of beers, both on draught and in bottles. Tons of stuff I've never heard of before and that's the way to my heart. 

Awesome and kind staff, able and willing to answer any questions you may have. 

Minimal, yet delicious, selection of German pub fare. We got a bockwurst at 1:30 AM and it was outstanding. 

Pretty decent-sized space.

PINBALL MACHINES?!

The bathroom was the worst part, but that's the Mission. 

I can't wait to go back.
author: Julia D.

description:
CASH ONLY!!!! 

An amazing variety of unique draft beers such as Allagash Saison! 

Drink menu is on a chalk board on the left side of the wall directly across from the bartenders and the food menu is behind them. A few affordable drink options, $2 Hamm can beer plus a couple other cost effective options

Fun retro arcade games plus a decent amount of seating but get there early if you want a spot for a large group 

Overall Thoughts

A great place to grab some beer with your friends!
author: Eddie W.

description: I came here around 12 midnight with a couple of friends. Only having two drinks, we were quite in our right minds when the staff told everyone to leave at 1:45. Without giving anyone any warning, they got very frustrated that customers didn't immediately leave (before official closing time, I might add).  Even though I am a no confrontational person (and this is this first review I've ever given), I told the staff who was ushering us out that perhaps next time they could give us a bit of a warning, even though I'm sure it wasn't his decision. I was still ushered out, given no explanation, and told I as given a warning. I will not be returning here. There are other bars in the area that give an expansive beer collection and have a typical closing produce instead of rushing customers out before closing time.
author: Deb J.

description:
Solid, low-key bar with a pretty good beer selection and plenty of seating for groups! The tables are huge, which is nice to not squeeze into a tiny space with your party, and there are outlets, which were a lifesaver when my phone died and I was planning on using Lyft later that night. Definitely a less upscale vibe in general than some of the surrounding places.

There's a selection of board games, as well as a bunch of pinball machines, to play too.


**Don't forget this place is cash only!
author: Alexandra H.

description:
I can't believe it was 7 years ago that this place opened, time flies.  I used to be a regular at this place when I was, you know, young and fun.  It was like a mini-Rosemunde, a cool bar to gather for beer and brats with friends mid-week.  Back then, it wasn't clear that this place was gonna make it though, it was empty a lot. 

And then they added the indoor bike racks and everything changed.  You see, the sad thing is that for any Mission dive bar to succeed, it has to attract some portion of hipsters, that had to be part of the revenue stream. So when they put those bike racks in, it was like hipster bait.  Now this place us teeming with hipsters, and they've expanded their menu and beer selection as a result.

In the end, this is still a very fine dive bar and now a stable in the Mission landscape. Lots of good memories here for me and it's cool to see a whole new generation forming their own ones now.
author: Saminda W.

description: This is the ritual hang out spot for any rides around the area. I typically stop by here after doing an alpine dam loop on the road or riding dirt on tamaRancho. They have great sausage options, as well as sides including the Bavarian potato salad.  Sauerkraut are always on point for the beers that rotate on top are delicious. Prices are super reasonable and they take credit card which is a huge plus when you don't want to carry a bunch of cash in your jersey pocket. I've actually even come out to Fairfax on noncycling days just to be in the ambience. Great place to come with friends for couples. Definitely kid friendly.
author: David M.

description: Great music blaring, retro arcade games (4 player pacman anyone?), grafitti art bathroom, and beers in "dass boot" serving make this place awesome and quirky. For those brave enough to try the boot, there is a deposit to prevent breaking and return of the glass. Not all beers are available in the boot either. Specifically the ones with a higher ABV %.
author: Jamie L.

description:
Free WiFi, good beer & sausages.
Very strange bartender......CASH ONLY!
author: Johnny J.

description:
I came here for the first time on a Wednesday night, and had a good experience.  

The bartender was helpful and friendly, which I really appreciated.  

I'm not a beer drinker, so I enjoyed a glass of wine along with a German pretzel with spicy nacho dip (tasty!). 

All in all, a good dive bar to grab a drink and catch up with friends.
author: Barnali D.

description:
Spacious, clean, good sounds on the box. What more could you ask for? How about an amazing selection of brew! This is my second venture here with my friend. Tonight there was Artwork from local artists displayed on the wall - excellent exposure for locals. Great way for the pub to be actively involved in the community. Bonus star. We also noticed a small dog hanging out on a bar seat. His name was Taco. 

Nuff said!
author: Jaylena P.

description:
Decent selection of beers, but it was very loud and dark, which I shouldn't have been too surprised about. There were some tables and a dirty couch, but most people were standing. 

Best thing was a 4 player Pacman game though! I may have to stop by again only to play that.
author: MaryKate M.

description:
For some odd reason, I always end up at Gestalt Haus when I'm going out in the Mission. Maybe its the constant allure of the boot or the fact that their name becomes a lot harder to pronounce after a few beers.

Pros:

- The beer selection is phenomenal. You'll find yourself staring at the wall for a good 10 minutes trying to pick something out. If you're a fan of German beer, you'll be in for a treat. Spaten Optimator is the way to go. 

- Das Boot. 2 liters of whatever beer you fancy. Not many bars in the city have it, so take advantage of this rare experience. The boot will not disappoint. Just make sure you're sober before you start, or else you might have trouble.

- Pinball machines, couches, and German themed decorations. Pretty sweet layout and a nice relaxing feel.

- Relatively spacious. If you can't get a seat on one of the chairs or couches, there's plenty of standing room, even on a busy night. You won't find yourself rubbing up against people.

Cons:

- Only one horrid, disgusting bathroom. You'll be really lucky if you don't have to stand in line for it. Doesn't look like they have room to build another bathroom, but it would greatly help. I feel bad for the ladies who have to endure the constant piss-covered toilet.

- Bartenders aren't too welcoming. They're not rude, but they don't really have anything good to say.

- $40 deposit for the fragile boot. Be VERY careful. I've had a friend break the boot once from a simple clink with someone's glass. If you must clink, do it with the thicker base.

While there's a great selection of heavily themed German bars in SF, Gestalt Haus is more laid back and has that chill neighborhood bar feel. Definitely worth checking out if you're in the area.
author: Dmitriy S.

description: Strong beer selection, with short-order sausages and sandwiches. Also cheap, with the sausages and many draft beers coming in at $6. New great spot for me, can't believe I walked by it so many times!
author: Andrew J.

description:
I was hoping this place to be more lively on a Friday afternoon but it wasn't. They had good beer, but it seemed like they didn't have a good selection when we went. I wanted to see beers that I've never heard of before or at least breweries from the area but didn't. Honestly I was looking more on the Russian River end but not even one single beer was on tap that was from Russian River. The decor was a nice little Dive Bar ish kind of place, I would like to come here after work or watch a game. 

I noticed that there was a boot but didn't bother asking, guy behind the bar had no social skills at all. It was whatever. 

I would give it more stars but the beer selection was pretty bad that day. Down the way Monks Kettle had better bear in my eyes but came here because that place was too busy. I'll definitely give this place a chance again, just hope they carry some Russian River at least.
author: Aryan O.

description:
Gestalt is actually a branch of psychology which is based on a theory that what people need to do in order to "heal" or "be complete" is to look at the big picture, in which the whole is more than the sum of its parts.

So why is this bar called Gestalt, you ask?

Answer: I have NO effing idea. It's known for being a hipster beer bar in the Mission where you can hang your bicycle on the wall while downing pints of quality international brews. The walls are red, it has a pool table, and the bathroom is gross. There are some well-worn couches/chairs at the front of the bar, but the music (did I mention the live DJ?) might make it difficult to sit back and read. The bar advertises that it's a great place to watch sporting events, and rocks 4 big screen TVs. They also serve various 'wursts, including a vegetarian bratwurst (welcome to SF!!), so nobody has to go hungry. 

Drink-wise, they offer 20 beers on tap in additon to a variety of bottled foreign beers, and the bartender will permit you to taste the beers before you buy one. I went with Young's Double Chocolate Stout, which was fantastic. All of my friends enjoyed their draughts, served up in fancy glasses. Prices are generally in the $5-$6 range.

This Gestalt definitely has a lot of parts, but I'm not sure that it makes a cohesive whole.
author: Ray J.

description:
This place kind of rocks. It's chill, you can hear your friends (at least on Mon-Thurs nights... haven't been here on peak nights), and the beers here are no joke. For a dive-y bar, this place is pretty cool. I need to come back for the sausages.

My favorite? Grapefruit beer. I hate grapefruit, but this beer rocks. It's practically beer for wussies like me who like very sweet to cider beers. On the other hand, this place does pack a lot of "real" beers and a good variety of them are available on tap.

Oh, there's also pool and arcade games! Drunk gaming - how can you go wrong?
author: Joanne Y.

description:
I have ulterior motives for writing this review. I'm hoping someone can nicely tell me the name of the beer I had here recently, because I very much remember asking the bartender TWICE what it was, and obviously I have already forgotten. Here's what I know: (1) It was from a brewing company based in Michigan (Minnesota?). (2) It was in a bottle. (3) It was suggested to me because I like Drakes Brewing's Aroma Coma. (4) It was delicious. 

All that aside, I came here recently to catch up with a friend before heading to a date two doors down. We split a pretzel and a bockwurst and had drank a few (mystery) beers. The bar staff and patrons were friendly and engaging, and I'm too distracted trying to remember this beer to write a real review.
author: Jennifer B.

description: Great selection of draft and bottled beers including a lot of hard to find Belgium beers. If your hungry you can compliment your beer with a sausage or sandwich. They even have a pool table. Only compliant is that they play the music too loud sometimes so you have to tell too talk to the person next to you.  Besides that this bar is a definite must stop for any beer drinker in San Francisco.
author: Teddy M.

description:
Warning: Do not lean against the wall in this bar.

Why? Bugs!! Crawling on the wall next to our table for two located directly across from the bar!!

Aforementioned bugs then began crawling on me as I pawed at myself like a flea bitten cat!! 

My friends who were standing were witness to these little insects, so we moved our group to the big table in front by the window, just to finish our beers and get the heck outta there.

Oh, and don't even think about going to the bathroom. There is no handle on the inside of the door and it's stanky. 

You have to pound on the door and pray that someone standing in line will hear your cries for help above the loud DJ beats.

Never again.
author: Diana V.

description:
Minus one for the restroom? But well... wasn't sure if I should deduct the star because it wasn't AS bad as many others I've seen. Otherwise it was a great time. 

My bud and I had fun battling it out over pac man. 2-player but could be 4-player.  Fitty cents per game per player! Bring those quarters!

I had a black rye ipa and a hefeweizen. Had a taste of their jalapenos that they put on the hot dogs... super hot but delicious since I like them that way. 

Very relaxed setting. Ok for bringing dates since you can actually hear each other and everyone minds their own. 

Great for watching games as well :) Saw Warriors win that night
author: Krisanne N.

description:
I'm gonna go ahead and bump up this one to a solid 4. A few years ago (in 2011!), I wrote a less than stellar review about this place. However, after wrapping my lips around one of their vegan sausages, I have to give them credit. They do offer some solid veggie noms. 

I ordered the Vegan Italian sausage. It comes with sauerkraut, and you can add peppers and onions if you'd like. I asked for both, but they forgot to add them. Meh, not a huge issue. 

There is a condiment bar on one wall to help yourself to all types of saucy goodness. I topped mine with a delicate squiggle each of ketchup and spicy mustard. Mama mia, that thing was delicious! Lip smacking good. I was tempted to order another, but I was able to hold back my gluttonous instincts. 

I mentioned in my last review that they don't serve any booze, just beers. Oddly enough, I can't really drink hard alcohol all that much anymore. Admittedly, after a few too many brews, I feel a little gassy and bloated. Even so, it is much preferable than feeling too drunk, dizzy, and/or nauseous. I enjoy sipping on a cold pint, enjoying the bubbly bite, and just kicking back and putting my worries behind me. 

The one bathroom deal is still kind of a kick in the pants, but if you get there early enough, it's not an issue. Just don't make the mistake of holding your pee until you feel like you're going to burst. Just another helpful hint from yours truly.
author: Brandi W.

description: Great place for beers (no hard alcohol). They have great sours and bottled beer and beer on tap but the atmosphere is not conducive to conversation at all. Extremely dark and loud and tiny with a line to the bathroom that lasts almost out to the front door.  Be really drunk to enjoy this place with friends
author: Kristin C.

description:
Beer Stop 29
---

I ended up stumbling upon Gestalt Haus after walking back from Monks Kettle. I noticed a good DIPA on tap, so I figured, why not give it a shot. When I asked for the beer at the bar, they were all out. Instead of getting up, my girlfriend convinced me to stay and enjoy a drink.

Ended up ordering a "craft beer light" beer. Most of the beer on tap was overly-bottled craft beer types. This is a good place to grab a drink as you first enter the craft beer world.

overall, I really wasn't that impressed. It was a very dingy place with one or two good beers, but nothing else going for it.
author: Justin A.

description: It's roomy place. Unlike other bars , which is usually packed with people, it's a comfortable place to sit down , have a drink and chitchat with your friends. The bathroom is covered with graffiti which is so cool! Will definitely go again :)
author: Pauline W.

description:
This was an amazing find next door (almost) to Monk's Kettle where you don't have to sacrifice half your limbs and donate your kidneys to buy a beer. In fact, this place may be even better than Toronado if I dare say so!

The same style is found where this is a cash only bar with great beers on tap, fantastic selection in the bottle and a fun atmosphere with a great bartender. The sausages... yeah not sure how they stack up against Rosemunde (sp?) but the beers here surely are fantastic. 

We arrived early in the night right after dinner just to chill and grab a drink, ended up staying for many rounds trying out all kinds of recommendations the bartender had. I love bars like these because they have character, arcades and pool tables and bartenders who actually like beer, like their own product and can make a solid recommendation instead of just whatever seems to take your money. It's definitely a bit of a hipster vibe but you can fit in just fine.
author: Lorrie M.

description: Dive-y feeling bar with lots of pinball machines.  They've made some nice renovations lately with taking out the pool table and making more room overall.  The beer selection is fabulous.  We cannot resist going here whenever we are around the area because for the past 6 or 7 months they have had Sculpin IPA on tap consistently.
author: Jessica L.

description: Great selection on tap, and delicious German-American pub fare (brats, potato salad, and house-made potato chips). There is a Gestalt Haus in Fairfax that is closer to my place, but I would much rather come to this location. I didn't get to play any of the games (pinball and such), but I was able to relax and watch some sports on the flat screens, as well as people-watch. Gestalt Haus seems to be a perfect place to hang with a group of your friends, as there is ample open floor space and high-top tables.
author: Tyrone V.

description:
Showed up late on Friday night. Reggae blasting, packed bar, awesome tap list. Prices are reasonable. 

This is a keeper, and probably one of the best bars I've been to in SF.

I would go back, it's just a bit far from where I normally stay :)
author: Jonah K.

description: Another great dive bar in the plethora of dive bars in the Mission. With pinball machines. And snausages.
author: Mel G.

description:
WHY IS IT SO LOUD IN HERE?? WHAT?? WHY'S IT SO FUCKING LOUD IN THIS PLACE? I DON'T KNOW WHAT YOU'RE SAYING!! 

I motion for the door. 
"holy shit it was loud in there."
"Yeah that's what I was trying to tell you."

"I thought it was British beers that were supposed to be warm, not German."
"Yep..."

If you hate being able to hear, a German theme with very little German beer, this is the place for you.
author: Scott S.

description:
Loving the wide selection of beers they have. And it's a decent price for SF too! 

Bartenders were nice although one of them seemed to be having an off day. Bathroom is really clean too! 

Retro lighting, pinball machines, beer menu on a chalkboard, and graffiti all over the walls make for a really chill bar. Great for a relaxing night to wind down with a friend or two.
author: Winnie T.

description: Iiiii think this place is great. But then again I'm a sucker for arcade games and salty pretzels. Hopefully one day I have one, because they ran out of pretzels and it's not even 11 yet. Spacious, great vibe, great music. I had the vegan smoked apple sage sausage - it was okay. A solid 3 star sausage. Mmm sausage.
author: Chay T.

description:
Haiku for Gestalt:

All your favorite beers
German name, Mission place, and
A can of champagne

Hipster review, but this is a hipster place. Seriously though, fantastic beer selection and the champagne-in-a-can comes with a cute pink straw!
author: Nicolas H.

description: I loved the Fort Point Nosch and Sculpin on tap for light beers! Yum.  AND they have framboise, always a plus. Tried a few IPAs including Fieldwork Stone Surge which was good. Bartenders are so nice. I love this bar! Will be back for some bar bites soon.
author: Jordan Q.

description: Never disappointed when I come here! Ryan is the best bartender he serves up a nice pour every time! The pretzels although I wish were more fresh are still delicious! I must try the other foods they have. They also would play game of thrones every Sunday night! They have games and a giant pacman machine! The draft beers are why I really come here though, and the list is always on point and extensive! Come here and you won't be disappointed. :)
author: Amber T.

description:
Gestalt Haus is the rookery of slim and young men clad in plaid. There's even complimentary parking for track bikes inside. After a few beers, though, they should play pin the bike helmet on the hipster. A skull is a terrible thing to waste.

Just around six on a Thursday, there were only about five people at the bar. Two in plaid. It's a dark bar in the back and I had to strain my myopic eyes to read the menu, though I got by with a little help from my friend. There's a handful of good beers on tap, and many more expensive Belgians and otherwise in bottles. Hoegaarden on tap, so I was happy. There was a small menu of bar food, and the potato salad with bacon was only three dollars and was sehr lecker! The bartender was pretty rude; he reminded me to tip when he gave me my change. Of course I would tip! Why wouldn't I tip? He said that a lot of people don't. I suppose he felt that the revolution would start with me. A whisper in San Francisco would turn into a tornado across the country of people wising up and dropping tips? I tipped as I always do. Hope he's saving up for a plaid shirt. 

I sat as far away from that guy as possible, near the front there is a lot of light coming in. I counted about eight more plaid shirts coming in, and over the next forty-five minutes it became crowded. Wonder if all those people tip too. 

I'm not a bike messenger, don't have any plaid (except a skirt, and I don't think that's the look the bar is going for), but I liked Gestalt Haus. Beer and spuds can unite farflung social identities and wardrobe choices any day.
author: Joanna M.

description:
I always laugh when people use their review to wonder if this place is "trying to be Toronado" or "trying to be Rosamunde." If I wanted to live in a place with just one beer bar or just one sausage place, I would have stayed in Vermont.

They have some of the best toasted sandwiches around (or are they just **trying** to be Ike's???)
author: Jenny P.

description:
Gestalt is the value monks kettle.  It's $6 instead of crap tons, and the vibe is a bit more chill than the hectic crowdedness that is monks kettle.  The drakes stout or the delirium on tap or the allagash is a good sign. 

They won't serve you a cocktail so don't even try it!

This place is interesting because they do all sorts of things that don't let you pigeon hole them into a specific kind of bar.  One night the are dark inside with a laid back vibe, the next a karaoke bar with people screaming through a speaker at the top of their lungs.  The fact that this place is so variable is in direct contrast to the particularly consistent weather of San Francisco.  Come here for great beer but be prepared to occasionally want to leave because of whatever vibe has congealed within the red walls of Gestalt.
author: Alex H.

description:
Vegan sausages, that's what brings me here. I'm almost positive they use the Tofurkey bratts (I haven't confirmed), best when grilled, which is the method of choice at Gestalt. They have meat ones too but thankfully they're slick enough to have separate grills.

And what do you need after a kraut covered vegan bratt? 

Beer: and luckily for us all this place has some good ones to wash down the sausagy goodness.

In my opinion this place has all the fixin's for a perfect hang out kind of place. Couches, pool, food and beer, all you have to do is add people and you've got yourself a decent evening.
author: Justin N.

description: I always love this place.  The bartender is friendly and very attentive.  Great selection of beer.  He is very good at helping me try something different.  Sandwiches are good and he will mix it up for you.  Then there is the Pinball.  Maybe it is because I am 65... but I love pinball.  Easy going and friendly.
author: India G.

description:
So I really should have reviewed this place a long time ago, but I've only now gotten around to it. 

This place is great. The staff is so friendly and always remembers me. The food here is great for hangovers, park days(to go), and just wanting a sausage or a sandwich day. 

They always work with dietary restrictions without a fuss and the beer selection is great. I recommend coming during the day. It's a bit slow, but that way you have the run of the place.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Beer, beats, five different pinball machines (Star Wars), $6 vegan wieners... I'm in! 

Everyone from the ID checker to the bartenders were midwestern-friendly and super welcoming. Even quizzing me on Chicago sports once seeing my place of origin on my ID, though I think they were a little bummed when I said the only thing I know about sports is that Bill Murray likes the Cubs. 

With just one single stall bathroom, Gestalt House is an easy place to make friends while you stand in line for 20-minutes doing the potty dance and holding your crotch so as to avoid any leaks. I recommend using the stop watch on your phone to time people going in and coming out. Definitely let them know you're doing it, have the rest of the line cheer them on from outside and reap the benefits of everyone ahead of you working that much harder to do their business faster beat the previously posted best time. 

I made another special friend while checking out the previously deserted pinball machines. A fellow approached me holding a fifth of generically-branded vodka (obvi he was going undercover byob) and can of sugar-free Red Bull. He introduced himself to me and asked if I liked pinball, to which I replied, 'of course',  but expanded that I won't play it because it's just a money sucker... though I don't think he was listening because his eyes just rolled back in his head and then he asked me the same pinball question again, then requested I hold his empty Red Bull can as he unwrapped a wadded up $20 bill with a small, white, crumbly powder ball inside and dropped it in his vodka bottle, then poured vodka/powder blend into the Red Bull can I was holding. He then took the Red Bull can back, didn't thank me for helping him (probably) commit a crime (rude!) and the next time his eyes rolled into the back of his head I took it as an opportunity to do a slow robotic, backwards walk away from the scene. 

So there you have it. Colorful, undercover unsavory, decent beer selection at reasonable prices and they had a really fun DJ.
author: Candice G.

description:
Holy boots, Batman!

I'd been hearing about this place for ages, and always wondered why it seemed so much more spacious inside than any of the other Mission bars, like there was some horrible secret lurking within that I didn't know because they only printed it in 7x7 or something. 

Turns out, this place is a great hidden gem that hasn't caught on nearly as much as it should have. (Keep it between us, OK?) The team is friendly, the after-midnight crowd was a blast, and the boots. You can get beer in a giant glass boot to share. My crew killed off four before we closed the place out. 

The boots...they are evil. Tasty evil. In boot form. Bring several friends or a brave date and find out for yourself!
author: Kevin B.

description:
Walking down 16th, I noticed a neon sign advertising Krusovice, something I've never seen outside of Czech Republic. We had to go in. Sadly the Krusovice itself is currently discontinued, as not enough people were familiar with it to keep it in stock. However, they do have Staropramen on tap (again, a Czech beer I've not seen on draft in the US outside Chicago), as well as an enormous selection of German, Belgian, and regional American beers on tap. 

The atmosphere is friendly in a very casual kind of way. Music is classic rock & some metal. Overall it's like the biker bar from central casting, except friendlier, better music, & with an awesome selection of beers. Oh, and they also have German and other sausages, including two vegan options. Can't wait to go back.
author: Cage H.

description: Really good beer and food! A must try place! The service was fast and the bartenders are nice people I'm definitely coming back
author: Victoria T.

description:
mmm'kay, this is a beer bar, (no cocktails, got it?) with a fantastic selection of craft beers on tap, as well as a similarly fantastic selection of bottled craft beers. Further, you can get super cheap cans of Olympia or Tecate, if that's your jam. And yeah, there are bottles of Bud and a few other beers of that sort if you go there too.

But that's not why I go here. I go for the sandwiches (and the beer).

Ho. Ly. Sh*t. (Don't get me wrong, the sausages on a bun are great as well).

But these sandwiches blow my mind, and I've been on a mission to explore every single one of them on the menu. As of this writing I've got 4 more to go out of about 20 (though a couple of those remainders don't excite me).

My favorites (in no particular order):

 - The Bird
- The Charlie Sheen
- The Meatwad
- The Haus Ruben

It's possible that this place has had its ups and downs, but in the time I've been going there, mostly during the daytime when it's chill for food and a few beers, it's been awesome. The bartenders are super nice, and the people have always been very friendly. Evenings are probably a little noisy, and the food shuts down at 8pm, so keep that in mind.

Also? PINBALL, and they're happy to give you as many quarters as you need to play pinball or pool.

I love this place.
author: Rick A.

description:
All you need to know about Gestalt Haus -

1.  Good bartenders
2.  Good music over the loudspeakers
3.  Amazing beers - Allegash and Delirium Tremens on tap
4.  Awesome pinball machines - Medieval Madness, Funhouse, Addams Family, and Star Wars!  5 balls for 75 cents!

If I lived in SF, this would be my local bar.  Hands down.  No question.  High five.  Fuck yeah.
author: Thai D.

description:
I came here to drink beer. With my friend. Real beer. With a real friend. Good beer. Perfectly poured in the right glass kind of beer.

We stood (because tables and chairs are scarce but I cared not) It was successful. I want more beer. 

I wish there was one in my town. There is not. You should go just because I can't. Then tell me about it. So I can dream about it.

Mmmmm. Noch ein bier bitte!
author: Jessica S.

description: I'm a weirdo who likes to write/work during the day in dive bars. This place is blissfully perfect. It actually almost feels like a coffee shop and a bar had a child. The staff are nice, the bathroom is clean, and the people who pop in and out all seem to know each other. Super chill throwback to when you didn't have to be a pretentious fuck to enjoy yourself at a neighborhood bar. All the yes.
author: Ryley P.

description:
Two words: beer selection.

A little grungy, a lotta awesome. Definitely a stop whenever I'm in the Mission.
author: Emmeline A.

description:
Love this place. Great beers on tap with good craft options. The sausages are delicious too. 

The atmosphere is open and inviting, and doesn't feel like a typical "bar". Almost feels a bit like an indoor beer garden. I also love that they also have spaces for cyclists to bring their bikes inside and park on wall-mounted racks. Definitely my kind of place! 

My only complaint is the potato salad: it's really boring and flavorless. Don't waste the money or the tummy space. Stick to the beer, and a sausage on a pretzel roll!
author: Julie F.

description:
Great taps, impressively large variety, and hey, they have greasy-looking food too for when you've had one too many. But wait, there's more! There's a pool table that costs $1. Also, the beers come in 0.5L European glasses instead of American pint glasses, so you're getting... uhh... 5.66% more for your money! :)

Seriously, there's not much to complain about this place. It's well rounded and solid at everything they do. Reminds me of Bender's but with a bigger beer choice.
author: Josh K.

description: On our 16th bar crawl I noticed this place had pinball and immediately we stopped in. Tons of vintage pinball machines which to me is a plus. Would like to see them less than $1 a play, but beggars can't be choosers. The place reminded me of a great bar in my hometown, but with a little bit of a makeover. It's not a dive by any means, but is pretty grungy. Perhaps the best part of this place besides the decent prices is the extensive beer menu. It has some pretty great beers without coming off as a pretentious craft beer locale. The menu is also awesome and has an array of sandwiches. Our bartender was able to handle the crowds, make food, and keep conversation and for that he gets my respect. He even gave us some koozies. Don't skip out on this place if you find yourself in the Mission.
author: Joshua C.

description: Only 1 bathroom for everyone, but this place just rubs me the right way. Lots of beers on tap and in bottles, and the bartenders are nerdy, but in a good way. Lots of tables and space, too, so that you can dance around to whatever Pandora might be playing in the background. They also serve sausages, pretzels, and chips, so that you can nosh on something while either watching a game or some obscure movie on the smaller tv. Very friendly people and interesting arcade games. Cash only! Come prepared.
author: Danny C.

description:
Great place to watch a game!  Caught the 49'ers play the Seahawks here and it was all about that home city pride.

I'm always a little hesitant about going out to watch a game at a sports bar, but Gestalt Haus made the experience comfortable and fun without being overly rowdy.  No, no.  I'm not a prude!  You can hoot, holler, and cheer all you want.  Just don't bump into strangers and spill your beer all over them.  

They have enough beer varieties to keep things interesting and whoever DJ'ed that day was awesome - cutting the pump up music in seamlessly when the commercials popped on.  Plenty to keep the crowd moving and excited for a game that ultimately ended in disappointment.
author: Kathleen W.

description:
Lot of beer selection :) friendly service but 1 bathroom. Holy moly guacamole!!!

I love the atmosphere. Friday night DJ was not that great but coz they have lots of beers to choose. That make it even
author: Fah Z.

description: Gestalt is a great spot to drink beer (they don't serve alcohol), one of the best on the 16th street strip in my opinion.  There's lots of room, good sausages and meaty sandwiches, and a wide selection of beer with which to wash them down.  Most importantly, though, they have $2 cans of Hamm's and Olympia.  It's a good venue for watching a game.  The bummer: only one co-ed bathroom.  At peak times the line will be super long.
author: John H.

description:
We came here to finish watching the 49er game on a hot Sunday.  The drink prices are average but the other patrons and the bartender were nice.  

Just a short walk from Dolores Park, it's a great place to grab a drink before you lay out in the sun.
author: Richard T.

description: Like a sweaty hot hipster pot. With shabby siding and good beer.
author: Emily D.

description: Leffe on tap and served in boots. Awesome!
author: Vince E.

description:
Gabe (or whatever the name of the Charles Manson look-alike bartender is) is the reason me and my friends will never come back to this bar. On a Friday night a few weeks ago, this guy threw in the garbage the food my friends ordered (and threw their money back at them across the bar) just because he was annoyed or something with a simple question about whether a side of potatoes was included in their sausage order. There is room for interpretation the way one of the veggie sausages is listed on the menu as it seems to include potatoes (but I believe it's in the actual sausage). 

Gabe's behavior was uncalled for and a flagrant abuse of his "authority" as a bartender. Another friend tried to step in and reason with Gabe like a logical human being but this guy only reacted like a raging a-hole (pardon my language). He does no favors for the bar and should be put into an anger management class. Just to give context, my friends are seriously the nicest people in the world and would not have done/said anything rude to merit this kind of response from the bartender. Regardless of whether he was having a bad night or the bar was understaffed, he should have had more self-control.

Also to be fair, there were other severs and bartenders who were much nicer but the experience with Gabe will color our opinion of the bar forever.
author: Amy B.

description:
What the heck is a vegan tuna melt? If I hadn't been stuffed to the gills before rolling into here, I would have gotten one or maybe a vegan sausage thingie.

We shared a pitcher of Spaten and then tried to get an IPA (not the Racer 5, but something else). They were out, so the bartender recommended the Tricerahops. Tasty double IPA. Obviously a hoptastic punch to the sinuses, but great for a summery night. ~$20 for a pitcher (counting tips)

A little loud for conversation since the DJ was really pumping whatever beats, but fun place to hang out.
author: Kevin L.

description: If you want a German beer, it's a good place to go. Their food was not impressive ...
author: Aijia Y.

description: Fine selections of both draught beer and pinball machines, and a pro-cyclist vibe add up to a five star experience. They even have a couple of big screen TVs so you can steal glances at the big game while maintaining your cred as a sports agnostic Mission hipster. Your secret's safe with us, pal.
author: Nick C.

description:
"No soup for you!"

Ordered a couple of sausages: one beef, one vegan. The vegan one is "with yukon gold potatoes" on the whiteboard. I come back 15 mins later to pick them up, and the vegan one is sitting naked in a bun. I ask him "doesn't it come with potatoes?" and he barks back "No, $4 more" and when I point out it says so on the whiteboard he pushes them at me and says "Fine, you get nothing with them". I flag him down to at least get some sauerkraut on it and point out it clearly says it comes with potatoes on the whiteboard, but instead he grabs them off me, throws them away, throws $15 at me and says "You get nothing at all, get the hell out of my bar!"

A Seinfeld moment. My girlfriend insists on clearing up the matter, which doesn't work with someone like that, and he leaves her crying. So our group left.

Apart from that: unclean, too loud to extent you can't order drinks, and a problem with homeless/crazy people wandering in. But they prefer to hire a DJ instead of hiring a bouncer. Nobody even checking ID.

My recommendation, like so many others here, is to go to the countless other bars in Mission which are much better, or to Zeitgeist, which Gestalt is just a poor, dirty, rude imitation of.
author: John R.

description:
Great beer selection and great service.  This is a nice spot if you can find a place to sit.

The problem?  Filthy bathroom and hundreds if not thousands of fruit flies!  No exaggeration.  I even found them in my clothes when I got home (shudder).

I've worked in many a restaurant, so I'm familiar with this problem.  May I suggest pouring a little bleach in all the drains (including the floor), and you should be rid of them in no time.
author: Raina S.

description:
Wife and I tried this place out during happy hour and we were absolute fans. My wife is a bit wary of places that seem too casual from the outside but even she warmed up to it once we were inside. Bartenders are very friendly and will help you with their awesome beer selection. Their food menu's quite unique too and we can vouch for the 'Louisana hot link' (I think) sausage as being delicious. I'm a dark beer lover and I absolutely enjoyed "Moose Drool" from Montana and another one I can't quite remember - have to go back again and update this review with it. It even has a little jukebox with some rock classics.

Gets loud and about. But rightly so!
author: Ash T.

description: All around nice: ppl, food n ambiance, vegan options, yay, recommend for semi mini trip to Berlin type place :)
author: s.y. d.

description:
Pros:

Great beer selection & a friendly bartender.  They had such a huge selection of beer I had a hard time deciding.  I ended up with a brown ale (Brett, possibly?) which was rich & yummy.  I like that they serve beer in those large boots, if that's your thing.  I stuck with a pint.  They serve lots of local brews as well as a ton of Belgian, German, & Czech beers.  Good happy hour where beers were between $4-5.

Cons:

Fruit fly invasion!  For some reason this place has a major problem with fruit flies.  We were sitting near the front window & they were all over the place.  I'm not sure what that was all about but it sure didn't make me want to try one of their bratwursts.  The bathrooms are in bad shape & yep, full of fruit flies.  Ick.  The music was a bit loud for my taste, but now I'm just sounding like an old fuddy duddy.

Cash only.
author: Erin S.

description:
Ventured in after being disappointed by Monk's Kettle.

While the beer selection is not nearly as extensive as Monk's, the bar was much more up my alley.

There is a pretty decent selection of German brews as well as US crafts, probably 20 or so beers on tap.

Pinball machines, dimly lit with some neon, couches, music (wasn't thrilled with the popish selection that was playing while I was there though) and sausages.

The bar serves non meat alternatives but can't speak to the quality.  I had a Louisiana Hot Link.  Good stuff with some Moose Drool.

Not sure if they recently renovated the bathroom but it was no where as grimy as some of the reviews make it out to be. 

Stop in here if you are in the area.
author: Brian K.

description: Came in on a Thursday afternoon pub crawl. Spent about $15 for a beer and sando, certainly not breaking the bank as is common in other SF bar/restaurants. Sandwich (The Chickenhawk I think) was made by the bartender, and it definitely hit the spot. I will return soon to play Metallica pinball.
author: Jake L.

description: Good beer on tap including a number of sours! Yum. Dive atmosphere, pretty busy, fun for karaoke
author: Zara S.

description:
Had a fine time.  Large imperial pint sized brews.  Decent prices.
Italian pork sausage was just right.
Sure, it's not the cleanest place in the world.
It's a bar in the Mission.
Worked for me.
I did not have a bad experience with the bartender as noted by other's reviews.
author: Kev M.

description: I took some friends here since they were in town and we were blown away! First off there is pinball, can't go wrong with that.  Second, I am not much of a beer drinker but I tried Death By Coconut and I am in love. It was like a Dessert Beer. SO DELICIOUS.  Don't go with what you normally get at any old bar, get something different! They have the best selection, the bartenders are super nice, and there is plenty of space to hang out.  Will definitely be coming back!
author: Alicia Q.

description:
You know, I never noticed this place before. But while in the Mission on a sunny Saturday afternoon looking for a casual bite to eat, we noticed this bar looking place that advertised brats in the front. 

It was a totally casual place with a comfy, funky looking front area that had couches and old furniture. The back of the bar had a hunting game and pinball. There was also a juke box.

We sat at the bar and had a really friendly guy bartender that filled us in on what they had to offer to eat. I got the andouille sausage and Chris had the Louisiana hot link. 5 bucks each, not bad! They offer sauerkraut on them, which I love, and have spicy mustard and ketchup in a bottle. We each had a beer with our sausage and left full and satisfied. I have to mention it again, the bartender was really nice. A Saturday afternoon visit is recommended for a calm, chill visit.
author: Liz M.

description: I like to frequent this spot when I'm in the Mish.  Not only do they have several beers on tap and a great selection of my favorite style, IPA, they have pinball in the back area.  I love thier hophead red ipa.  As far as food, I have only tried the Bockwurst which was tasty.  My two favorite pinball machines, Medieval Madness and Theatre of Magic, are in there.  They have some great tunes pumping out of thier jukebox, mostly post punk jams.  A great watering hole if your into beer, sausages, and pinball.
author: Pedro N.

description:
Who doesn't love beer and weiners?!?! Those are my two favorite things in this world.

Gestalt has one of the best beer selections in the MIssion. The menu even has its own chalkboard wall in front of the bar with ABV's included, so you can grab something hoppy in the double digits. 

There's an indoor bike rack at the back of the bar, so you biking folk don't have to worry about your bikes being messed with on the sidewalk. 

I overindulged in IPAs, as per usual, and the bartender told me I needed a 'deep dick.' Well, duh. Always. However, this deep dick is a wrapped sausage with condiments inside. It came with a side of orange crack sauce (probably thousand island dressing with seasonings). It was perfect. Like, if that deep dick was Kiera Knightly, I'd hold a sign out in front of its place that said "To me, you are perfect."

Weeknights and Sundays are the best nights. I've watched an entire episode of Bob's Burgers at the bar. 

*Don't forget the cardinal rule of the Mission: BRING CASH
author: K M.

description:
Sausages and beer? Yes please. Came here after Dalva and was very excited to put something in my tummy after a night full of drinking. We ordered sausages and some hoegarden beer. Sausages took a bit long but they are hot and juicy!! 

Atmosphere was great but I do have to mention there was a guy there reading a book at the bar. Nothing wrong with reading but not in a dark bar. Did I also mention when I kept sneezing he kept turning around shaking his head and giving me dirty looks?! Ah what a night. :)
author: Victoria Y.

description: Met a friend here for drinks after work. It's a solid place for drinks and the guys at the bar were pleasant. We ended up ordering food (they have a menu - ask for it), and their sandwiches weren't too shabby. They also have a pretty good selection of video games. I'd return
author: Candace R.

description: This place was cool, but a little loud. The beer selection was awesome and they had enough beers on tap to be interesting, but not so many that it's overwhelming. The arcade games are a fun touch, but be sure to have quarters! I loved that there were so many tvs, which is always a good thing in a bar. I came here on a Tuesday, so it was kind of slow, but the bartender and the DJ were both really nice and fun. Overall, I'd definitely be back!
author: Steph U.

description: A year ago, I would have doled out a 5 star...but how things change.  The sandwiches got smaller, the menu got more expensive and what used to be hop heaven feels more like they selected the beers from the discount list.  Cash only, one single person bathroom, plus the aforementioned adds up to a solid 2.5 stars, but couldn't bring myself to round down.  I previously would make the trip here when I wanted a great sandwich, but now only if I am in the hood and there is nothing else that interests me.
author: Daniel W.

description:
pinball machine heaven(they have 4 including medieval madness), good wide spanning beer selection, and warm pretzels. what more can ya ask for? walk in to the fresh smells of fluffy pretzels. they sometimes have a few dogs hanging around. they carry tons of craft beers so its a little on the pricey side. 

the only thing that sucks is the bar is really narrow and it can get a little hot inside.
author: Megan L.

description:
I'd heard that they'd taken out the bike racks but I had no idea what the ramification of that was.

I hadn't been in for a while and was shocked at the change. it's no longer the rowdy, dark, loud cycler bar it once was. One of the other patrons informed me that there was a new owner.

While it was not as fun as I remember it this change is probably a smart financial decision, I suspect the yuppies are going to win the war for the Mission.

*******************7/25/2008******************************

Great! The too cool for school Zeitgeist biker (not the cool kind of bikers) crowd have another bar to hang out at! How long has this place been here and how is it that I didn't hear about it until recently? I love liter mugs of beer and German sausages cooked on a George Forman grill!!!
author: Manny F.

description:
Kilowatt, Elixir, Dalva...  these are just three bars within a half block radius that are better than Gestalt.  Save yourself a headache with the holier than thou bartenders here and try anywhere else in the Mission.

Seriously, Gestalt makes Medjool look almost tolerable.  Don't go.
author: Dan S.

description: This place was awesome!  Fun place, wasn't super crowded when we were there.  Lots of great beer choices and decent seating selection.  Great beer selection, and if you like pinball and old school games, I'd check it out.  I like these places with "movie walls" where they play these old 80s movies.  Cool decorations in here too.  I'd definitely go back.  Bike parking?  Probably, it is the mission
author: Charles C.

description:
It is getting near to Oktoberfest time and I have been Jonsing for a German sausage and a half liter. I was looking hard for a place to get my fix last Sunday, and it seems every place that has German food In SF is either only open for dinner or closed on Sunday. 

This is what brought my Wife and me to drive from Crockett to SF to pay Gestalt a visit. 

As you can imagine parking was hard, but after driving around for 15 minutes and kicking myself for not taking Bart, we found a spot two blocks away. Later I saw a lot about a half block from Gestalt on 16th that offers parking for $5. 

We ordered a wurst and a hot link. Both were tasty, especially as they were served on a warm toasted bun with sauerkraut. The warm potato salad with bacon was very tasty. I really enjoyed it. Everything washed down smoothly with Spaten on tap. The German beers they have on tap are served with class as they would be in Germany, in glasses designed by their respective breweries. 

The folks serving the beer and doing the cooking were very friendly. I would love to go back to Gestalt. 

My advice to the owners, if they are reading this, is to beef up your German food menu. Since most places that serve German food in the City are only open for dinner, you could get a few new lunch time customers (and me coming back) with an offering of schnitzel sandwich, more wurst varieties, and (cross my fingers) some authentic tasting pommes frites with sweet style German catsup.
author: Chad P.

description:
Great place!
Good beer selection for reasonable prices. Friendly crowd. Nice mix of locals and visitors. Service was friendly and attentive. Cleanliness gets a medium score, that fits the mood of the place. Great little hangout. Will be back next time I'm in town.
author: J R.

description: Their pinball machines are all so awesome and amazing. It's a great place to hang out with friends and eat the 16th Street Hotel Club sandwich. It is delicious, with maple roasted chicken, Black Forest ham, crispy bacon, and aioli on French bread
author: Krystal S.

description:
I love you, Gestalt.  Always have, always will.  This would ordinarily be a total no-brainer five-star superjoint.  So why the A-OK?

If you are looking for the standard, no frills, kinda uppity but still tolerably cool Gestalt Haus of lore, then DO NOT COME HERE ON A WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  I mean I'm a pretty chill person who finds hilarity in just about anything dry, inappropriate, or otherwise devoid of funny -- but Lord Almighty this was a horrible experience.  Came here with my bro and some other peeps, including two SoCal visitors with whom I was overly eager to share the experience that is Gestalt.  UGH.  Our beers couldn't have been chugged fast enough.  MAKE IT STOP ALREADY!  Best part of the night was the cute nerdy dude at the bar who yelled "TELL SOME JOKES!" after the first couple duds.  Never before has a free comedy evening completely ruined the rest of mine so badly.

Also, a little air conditioning for us fat out-of-shape strangers from out the way please?  Thank you.  There's only one bathroom -- ONE -- but eh, that's SF (and more specifically the Mission) for you.

Gestalt has an awesome beer selection, great prices, typically fine music and a great sausage menu.  They generally choose awesomeness to broadcast on the TVs.  HOWEVER.  You have been forewarned.  Woody Allen once said, 'comedy is tragedy plus time.'  Elvis once sang, 'you look like an angel...  but you're the devil in disguise.'  Here ya go, aspiring Gestalt comics:  WHAT YOU SAY IS NOT COMEDY, BUT HORRIBLE SOLILOQUIES THAT SHOULD NOT BE HEARD BY ANYONE.
author: Monica D.

description:
Super laid back and not packed. Awesome beers on tap (my fave is the Tricerihops) and sausages to snack on (andouille was tasty)! 

Cash only and horrible cell phone reception.
author: Karena Q.

description:
My girlfriends and I just absolutely LOVE this place. Sure, it can come across as just another Mission bar at first, but a closer look at their drink list and you will have the impression that this place knows business.

The prices are decent, too.

I'm a big fan of sour beer, and I don't think there is a place in the Mission that can provide Duchess, or Grand Cru as efficiently. The lack of pretentiousness is definitely a plus!

The only slight downside is the restroom. But it's not like I'm expecting it to feel like a hotel lobby... Still worth a visit if you haven't yet!
author: Marie A.

description: I like to get drunk here and read books here on my Saturday afternoons. Still pretty new to the city, but this is my "go to" bar as I feel pretty comfortable here. Moose Drool on tap is great when they have it.
author: Eucalyptus J.

description: Justin is a great bartender! Very cool place, the best beer selection, & friendly staff. Cash only
author: Eric F.

description:
One word: BUGS.

Seriously. Big black bugs (yes, bugs. multiple.) crawling on the walls. Yuck.

On top of that, my cider (I'm not a beer drinker) was just meh. It's a cute looking bar with a pool table and a few arcade games, but the bugs pretty much ruined it for me. :-(
author: Kelly A.

description:
Gestalt Haus was quite interesting. I could not see the name of the bar, but they happen to put out a little A-frame that states its name and purpose, the purpose being its sole existence to provide those who want a cool little dive bar at which to grab an adult beverage.

Their beer selection is quite good, and they really do a fine job in taking care of their patrons. The pricing is fairly standard for San Francisco, and I like that they provide a little bit of everything for all sorts of beer lovers.

The 16th St. corridor appears to provide a good handful of bars, and there are many a fine establishment at which to get a drink in your digestive system which may also affect your thought process, and GH is certainly a good choice for that underlying motive.
author: Solomon W.

description:
Favorite memory of this bar:
First date. Guy shows up with no cash and no ATM card. Bar is cash-only. Almost all bars on 16th are cash-only. Solution: I buy two rounds of drinks for both of us. Never hear from the guy again. I guess I now know how it feels to be a guy in the dating world. 

I obviously won't come back here for a first date, but it's definitely a good spot for a midweek drink with a friend or two. The weekend gets a little crowded for me, but then again, so do all the bars along 16th. The music varies - some nights the have live music by local artists, some nights there's a DJ. There's not a whole lot of seating, but that's not usually a problem on weeknights. There's also a pool table that always seems to be used, but I'm sure if you wait around long enough you can claim it. I've never eaten the food, but it always looks tasty.

Important things to remember: All beer, cash-only. Bring cash or an ATM card. Seriously.
author: Talia G.

description:
I've been coming here since Gestalt opened, and while I liked it a little better before the remodel (gone are the plywood tables and the massive bike rack), it's still a great place to grab a beer or few with friends.  The bar now has several types of seating -- bar, table and sofas -- to accommodate diners, groups and individual patrons.  There is a limited menu of sandwiches and brats, all of which I've tried have been delicious.  They will also allow you to bring in outside food.  Gestalt's draft selection includes almost 20 beers; despite this, it doesn't feel like there is much variety, yet I always find something I'm happy to drink.   Service is quick even though there is usually only one bartender on duty.  They are happy to let you taste a beer before placing your order.

For your entertainment, there is an entertainment calendar of local DJs and a good juke.  Major sporting events are played, and in the hours when there are no games on, I've seen them play everything from music videos to soft core porn. 

As a side note, I have AT&T service, and NEVER have reception at all inside Gestalt.  Really a hassle when you're trying to meet up with friends. I've noticed the bartender goes outside to call/text so it's not just me!  It's really strange and kind of makes me feel lie they are doing something to block signal.  However, as of my last visit, I noticed they have free wi-fi, so at least I can get some messages out to the people I can't call....
author: Heidi M.

description:
Dear Gestalt, 

I think you are starting to be my favorite chill dive bar in SF. They never have cover compared to other dive bars around there. I love Mikey who introduced me to Hennepin Belgium white beer and bar tends on Mondays! Where else do they have randomly awesome beer/chip flavor selection?! I love their sausages: got the veel and pork bratwurst toppled with sauerkraut, ketchup, and mustard MMM.

I had great memories there for Halloween where they were blasting Wacka Flocka, chill Sunday nights playing pool with all the friendly locals, and random Saturday nights with DAS BOOT beer. This place makes me appreciate good company, good sausages, and good beer more, and for that I thank you.

Love
-Shirley

ps. Dont ever change. :)
author: Shirley L.

description: Not my favorite spot in the Mission, but solid.  Good beer selection, you can get some random eats (like random sausage/hot dogs.)  Cool place to bring beer enthusiasts and have drunk debauchery, but I do recommend bringing your own quarters if you want to play Pac Man!  They don't have a change machine so you have to ask the bartender... which I'm sure they're not overly excited about either :)
author: Brett B.

description:
We stopped in for lunch at this bar.  Who would think this German bar would have tasty & messy specialty sandwiches.

The sandwiches are made to order in front of you.  They may have unusual names but they are oh so good.  I ordered "The Bird."  It is a turkey sandwich with provolone, artichoke hearts, pesto mayo, garlic spread, red onion, tomato and lettuce on french bread.  You will need lots of napkins so be ready to get your hands dirty.

The potato salad is German style and it is spot on.  Growing up in a German neighborhood you crave potato salad like this.  Yum.

Next time I will definitely try another wacky named sandwich.
author: Megan P.

description: I love my beer. Hands down. When I first came I didnt expect much because there really wasn't a lot of people inside. However, DO NOT be turned off by such a thing. If you love beer, this is the place. The bartenders are very friendly and most importantly extremely knowledgeable of all of the beers they have in their posession. Shout outs to Katie who gave me and my homeboy a breathtaking "tour" of the beers they have on selection. Check it out! You won't be disappointed!
author: Jonathan M.

description:
