ah, I had the best night here. We stopped in just for a pint of beer before a movie, but stayed for the whole liter and skipped the movie. At one point of the night, Bohemian Rhapsody came on the jukebox and the whole bar burst into singing... It was like you were in a musical... with sausages.

The beer selection is great, the bartenders are awesome, and they pour generous tastings of their beer. Murphy is obsessed with the alcohol content of the beers, but that's good, at least you know what hit you. 1 liter of 8.5% alcohol beer and I was out... I also have a must-try list for my next visit at Gestalt. That thing in the bottle... Delirium Tremors? Just sounds yummy (10.5% alcohol)

I defo drank a lot of beer and even learned a bit about it. Beer tasting is so much more fun than snooty wine tasting. I wonder if they do a sausage and beer pairing menu...
author: Ayse B.

description:
A nice place to take your bike out for a date and some street cred. 

That being said, they're got a good beer selection on tap even if the bartenders are a bit snooty at times. Other than that there isn't too much special going on here, except maybe the vegan sausage... yum. 

All in all, it's a nice place to have a few beers when you don't really feel like hitting the bars but still want to be out of the house. 

It's definitely a bad idea to come here right after you have eaten a giant burrito. Just try and see how many beers you can fit in you before looking a tad bit green while searching for a bathroom to relieve the bloating.
author: Allyson S.

description:
I was dubious of the renovated G-haus, I'll admit.  Dingy and dark is my scene, but the old owner seemed to have trouble with the basics - like keeping the place full of beer, sausages, and potato salad - the only three things on offer.  So it was a nice surprise to find the place fully stocked, still plenty grubby, with lots of bike space on the walls, and a pinball machine in the back.  For those who miss the grafittied walls, don't worry - the astroturf bathroom walls are no match for the areas diligent taggers.  

The biggest change has been the weekend crowd - more of a frat boy-weekend hipster scene then before.  Weekdays are still a pleasure, the bartenders are great, the beer tasty and cheap.  The red walls and the art.... well, I doubt that will stay clean for long.
author: Josh C.

description:
Cheap beer and pool.
Nothing fancy, but sometimes I like it that way. I couldn't tell you what I drank or how much I drank but I was happy. Next time I must try some sausages, momma likes sausages!
 The hipster factor wasn't terribly annoying. I really wish I had a Hot Pink beach cruiser complete with basket and streamers to park on the rack.
author: Douggers M.

description:
What happened to one of my favorite SF bars??!?! Gestalt used to be one of the few reasons I would trek into San Francisco for a killer sausage and a huge mug of good beer, and now... *sigh* 

I went last night (5-1-09) for the first time in 4 or so months, and to my serious disappointment, the bar had undergone a big make-over, and not in a good way. Gone are the deer heads, bike rack, and over all cabin-like feel that I have always loved and looked forward to. Gone also are the people I enjoyed drinking and eating around. Instead, the walls are red with art that is less than pleasing, the lights are super bright, and hipsters abound. What a total bummer. Aren't there enough lame bars in the Mission? Why did you have to ruin a really cool spot?

In addition to the above, as if that wasn't enough, the bartender was a total choad. On two separate occasions he was rude to me, then my girlfriend went up to get her beer and he was a jerk to her as well. What's your deal man?  If you are gonna serve people, be nice and leave your shitty attitude at home. No one wants to experience that after a long day of work. 

The reason I gave two stars instead of one is simply for the music they were playing, lots of Van Halen (thankfully pre-hagar), Led Zep, and AC/DC. At least I had something decent to listen to while I drank my beer and stared in disgust at what is now Gestalt.

So sad...
author: Michou O.

description: Very cool - never been to a place like this. Tried the Prohibition Brand Porter (?) beer which kicked my ass. Music was great and the ambiance was lively. Good luck finding a seat and making sure you don't catch a disease in the bathroom ;)
author: Laurice F.

description: My friends and I were waiting on a list to be seated at the Monk's Kettle, and went down the street to the Gestalt Haus to have a few beers. It was a pleasant surprise! The beer selection was excellent, the sausages seemed delicious. The service was awesome, place had an excellent vibe and was great to just chill out in. I would have eaten here if I wasn't waiting to get into the Monk's Kettle. Next time i go San Francisco, I am making a stop here.
author: Chris N.

description:
This place has great beer on tap, the vegan sausage options are spot on. The bartender was friendly and efficient.  Patrons were chill and varied (a healthy cross section of hipsters and regular folk, straights couples, and me and my buddy, the gay ones).

We finished the night off with some Underberg.

Mmmm...
author: Sean G.

description:
The positives: liters of beer, nice bartenders who bought my friend 2 liters on his birthday

The negatives: no hard alcohol, not much seating, and my beer was warm and the bartenders were really reluctant to replace it (although they eventually did after me bitching for 5 minutes). 

The positives balance out the negative to make this place solidly mediocre.
author: Rebecca H.

description:
Loved it!    I haven't ridden a bike in years (not counting a drunken trip from the Mission to the Castro) but I still felt right at home at this place.  Both of the bartenders who've served me know their stuff--especially the one who I think might be the owner...He had some truly excellent recommendations. 

AND, call me crazy, but the patrons at this bar seem a lot nicer than the crowds at the nearby bars. (Fewer Marina transplants maybe?) I'll happily come back to Gestalt--no matter how much I drink, that liter never feels too heavy!
author: Eric E.

description:
Eight dollar liters of beer...liters...like the units of gasoline in Europe.  But instead of gasoline...beer!  And sometimes they have specials for $5 liters!

Plus many spots inside to park your bicycle...only in San Francisco's Mission District would a gem like this pop up.  Did I mention the liters of beer?
author: Mark D.

description:
My new favorite brew pub. Beer, Brats, friendly bartenders and an unfettered/unsharked pool table. Its all you could hope for in a neighborhood bar. First time, I went there they were just opening up. Watched them clear all the tap lines and then got tastes of nearly every Pilsner  and the whatever the other earlybirds were drinking before I could decide on my 1st  beer. I'm really not that indecisive. The taste tests just kept coming. 

Bartender not only new his beer but his Brats and old school music too. Would be nice if there were more old school punk and indie classics on the juke.
author: Sirima S.

description:
Wieners, beers, and bikes.  These are a few of my favorite things and Gestalt has them all.

I like to think of this bar as the indoor, smaller, more mild version of Zeitgeist.  It has a indoor bike rack so you can park your wheels without worrying about then getting stolen.  After you have done that belly up to the bar and talk to the eye candy behind the counter or the aging messenger sitting next to you.  Either way it will be a good time.

Gestalt gets all five starts for the delicious wieners, cold beer, good conversation, rockin' jukebox and sweet bike rack.
author: Alexis M.

description:
Went to watch the first game of the Stanley Cup Finals there. It was nice to have a big screen even if the resolution wasn't that great. 
The bar tender was friendly and the beer seemed reasonably priced. Had a lot of fun with the group I was with, but it was not exactly my kind of scene!
author: Rie C.

description:
Nice place. Its not too loud so you can chat and enjoy your self with your company. The crowd is also nice and laid back. You can be dressy or laid back.They also have bike racks inside which is very kewl. So you can always ride in, get a drink and some food.

The staff is very kewl, friendly and helpful. So do check it out.
author: Amlan S.

description:
We were on a supper binge and decided to stop in here before we called it a night.
We tried the Bocwurst which is veal pork sausage, it was tasty, peppery but had somewhat of a soft texture. Fiance had the hofbrau beer, it was very light and mild. Fun and interesting bar and the bartender was super friendly. They buy their supply of sausages from the nearby Schwartz place on 14th and Valencia.
author: Yan M.

description:
It's possibly not the most special and wonderful bar on earth.

They have Krusovice on tap (that is a good thing, because Czech beers are the most wonderful on earth).

They have indoor bike parking (massive plus).

They have sausage with real sauerkraut.  They have lamb, chicken and vegan varieties, depending if you're wanting to eat Little-Bo-Peep, some version of healthy or if you don't eat meat at all.

They are currently playing the Tour de France.

You can usually find a seat (a huge plus for a good bar in the area).
author: Jana T.

description:
1. park your fixie.
2. pay, like, $1 for a swimming pool of trumer.
3. eat a vegan sausage (italian is spicier than kielbasa.)
4. yell at your friends over music so loud you're actually having a conversation with the whole bar (and making friends with THEM!)
5. repeat.
author: Paula T.

description:
Surly bartenders, surly patrons. 

I came back for the fantastic tap selection. Lesson learned!
author: alejandro p.

description:
Lets see:

3 stars for a cool place that has bike rack and pool table. I love that.
-2 stars for a stupid bartender that judges me only because that day I was wearing a shirt, wanted to play pool with my date, and asked for Anchor Steam after coming from Monk's Kettle. Ok, man, whatever. And your Fat Tire tastes like shit, dude. Adjust the draft, please.
author: Javi V.

description:
I passed by this place a bunch of times... quizzically, at first... not sure if it was a bike shop, or what the hell. Upon further investigation on less drunk nights, I noticed it was a hoppin' little bar. Seemed a bit on the younger 20's hipster kinda cliquey hang out, so I kept a distance for a while.

It wasn't until a fateful night being invited there by a small band of homies that I was awestruck by an almost non-existent, and perfectly amazing  phenomenon in (probably the entire country...) .... The Liter. It was surely the beginning of a great night. And subsequent returns in the weeks to come.

I approve.
author: Marty K.

description:
Weiners are tasty...
hahahah sorry...that made me laugh...but for real this has good weiners, hahaha...
okay, i'll be serious now.  this place is cool, I feel like they didnt put any effort into making this place look nice, which is nice to see because it says to me "yes, you can get very drunk here, and everyone else will too."  I like that.  I also like the albino deer head on the wall, that was sweet and scary when to look at when your drunk...The beers and good and you can get those big ole ones too which gives you a work out as you drink trying to lift them.  All in all this is a cool place to drink a lot at.
author: christopher h.

description:
Lots of fancy beer and places to sit, the latter seeming rare in the Mission. Seemed like the kind of hipster bike bar that Seattle would be jealous of, as I've never seen a bike rack in a bar in Seattle, despite it feeling like the hipsters are more representative here.

Really nice atmosphere to relax in though, especially compared to super popular nearby alternatives.
author: Bryan M.

description:
Update Feb 17:

I had to remove some stars because their selection has taken a turn for the worse: more microbrew, less German and that's what made this place special.

One less star for rude-ass staff. Each time I go the bartenders are less helpful and just plain dicks. And I can drink elsewhere, so I will.

Jukebox is still good, but I can't feel the love as I once did over a year ago. If you are 22 and a total bike and microbrew geek who doesn't mind jerky service then you will love it here.

***
(original review)
This place is a default easy night out for us. The beer is good and plentiful. I love the selection, though one of the bartenders recommended an optimator as a "non sweet" beer. News flash: doppelbocks are sweet, friends.

Whatevs on service since you can usually get it fast and unhassled. There are a few bartenders that really kick ass and one that definitely doesn't.

Gotta love the big huge glasses. It's all about the liter and half liters.

I've had a few sausages and they're just ok, especially compared to the blissful home-made ones at Broken Record.
author: G Z.

description:
Let's add up some stars.

3 for the stuffed deer.
1 for the indoor bike rack.
1 for the yummie weenie.
-1 because i think $5 is too much to pay for said yummie weenie.
author: Levi B.

description:
I really don't appreciate getting hated on for ordering mass-produced beers. I'm sorry I don't know any of the beers you have on tap, Gestalt, and I apologize thoroughly for having a passionate love for Amstel Light.

I do, however, appreciate bars that are located within a block radius of my apartment. That's why you always get me, Gestalt. That's why you always get me.
author: C P.

description: Beer, sausage and a pool table.  What's not to like?  Only one bathroom I suppose.  If you're not a big fans of hipsters and the fixed gear crowd then you may not like it either.
author: Corey V.

description:
They have liters of beer for 9 dollars
They have half liters for 5 
They have pints for 4
They have delicious smelling sausages (I didnt try one YET)
They have lots of seating and a pool table 
If I rode a bike I would be excited because they have a huge indoor bike area .but I dont ride a bike
Its beer and wine only but thats fine by me because liquor gets me into trouble. 
All this and its tucked in between my 500 club and Delirium 
One star off for the fact that they have one unisex dirty bathroom
author: maryanncolby

description:
Gestalt is a place I find myself going back to over and over and I can't figure out why.  The people are friendly, I see many of the same faces, there is a pool table but the smell of sausage cooking on those George Foreman grills they have behind the car sticks to my clothes and hair (no bueno) and there is no hard liquor.  

Other than that, I can't say a bad thing about this place. I should also mention that the beer selection is good.
author: Rachel R.

description:
I had to take another star off because I wanted to put stuff on their jukebox and the selection was awful.  Someone needs to go into Kilowatt and see what a jukebox REALLY looks like.\

New setup is lame too - less bike parking?  Whatever.  I'll still come back here for a growler and veggie sausage, but I won't pretend like it's the best place ever.  Would love for this place to fix it's problems and become my favorite local - even if that meant it got busier.
author: Tmon B.

description:
Update October '07

The place has hit its stride.  The sausages are interesting and tasty.  They have nice potato buns and kraut.  Bar staff is friendly and fun to chat with.  

Yep yep.  Sorry for the pissy comments earlier... you're a-okay in my book.
-----------------
I guess I'll be the dissenting opinion here.  I had high hopes even after mourning the loss of Cafe La Onda, a perfectly fine beer-serving coffeehouse that it was a shame to lose.  

As for decor -- 
They gave the place a coat of black paint, hung some christmas lights and a few deer heads and opened for business.   The indoor bike rack and pool table are nice touches tho.

Solid beer list, but then that's not hard to find in this 'hood.  It can be hard to find a liter glass of the good stuff tho, so kudos on that.

It was in the sausages that I was most disappointed.  I wanted a nicely charred sausage maybe even with some grilled onions-- ooh, and a toasted bun would be great.  But, instead I got what tasted like a steamed sausage haphazardly topped with kraut and mustard.. no real love there.

Fine idea, poor on execution.
author: Krista G.

description:
Spawned in the Midwest, I am programmed for brats and beer.
Attitude?  Nope didn't see any. (OK maybe I was a little salty, but meh)
Unusually helpful and informative bartender, lots of samples to try.
So long space cowboy....
A++++ for the jukebox.  I think I heard some High on Fire.  Rawk.
Good frickin' snausage (thanks Mr. Foreman)
Even though fun -1 for not enough damn seating, fuck the pool table.
author: josh h.

description: After a long Saturday afternoon of moving office furniture, this place was good. Like wandering a dessert for a year and finding a Starbucks, good. Haven't been since, don't ask me.
author: Dustin S.

description:
The set up, the food, the beer selection, the bike racks, the pool table, the kick ass juke box. I heart this place! Week nights are nice and chill for a cozy beer date and good for that last drink at the end of the night.

 Me and my friends usually come here after the Elbo room on free funk Fridays. We wind up each getting one of their mighty liters of sweet hoppy beer, which winds up being the perfect night cap to sink you into bed at 2 in the morning.
author: Peter L.

description:
UPDATE - Talk about customer service, Daten from Gestalt Haus read of my yearning for my favorite bee, Haecker Schorr Weiss, and it's now available on tap.  Hurrah!!!  That deserves another star!  4/3/07

Let me preface this by saying that many of my formative beer experiences had to do with the second best beers in the world, German beers.  Coming from Chicago, crappy bars that were basically someone's living room, stocked excellent beers in every neighborhood I lived in.  So when I heard about Gestalt Haus, I got excited!  Mistake.  Always have low expectations in these kind of situations so you won't have your heart broken.

I checked out this place last night.  It was pretty slow around 9pm with about 8 or 9 patrons in the bar.  I walked by the two level bike rack in the bar.  Very cool, this place was getting at least a couple of stars just for that even if it's run by Nazis.  I asked the bartender if they carried my favorite beer, Haecker Schorr Weiss.  He sort of looked at me blankly.  At that moment I categorized this as a hipster bar not a German bar.  After a small sigh I ordered an Erdlinger, one of the few German beers they had, and plopped down at the bar.  Although Gestalt Haus isn't what I'd hoped for, it does have some positive points including serving sausages as well as Californized food, a good selection of non-German beers, a pool table and a great location on 16th near Valencia.  Decor is definitely dive bar.

A previous review indicated that beers were $3.  Not last night...pints were $4 and liters were $8.
author: John S.

description:
Why have I never reviewed you? I've been dropping in for over a year now. I like you. I am a little upset to have read that you were rude to other patrons. Also a little sad to hear that someone there bad mouthed tornado. I was drinking at your little bar one night and asked the bar tender at the time where he goes to drink, he mentioned tornado, so I think it's strange to hear anyone on your staff would bad mouth tornado. 

I personally have only had great fun time experience with you. I have still yet to eat there, but I am super curious to try out your vegan weenies. haha get it, because you have vegan weenies, but vegans are weenies. Oh man I'm funny. Your bar staff have been an absolute pleasure to give business too. I have always been greeted and treated kindly, even given a full on beer tasting once. I really do like you gestalt. I hope you like me.
author: danny e.

description:
I've been here a handful of times. I really like it! There are always nice people around enjoying themselves. I get a bit frustrated because the people playing pool are always bad and they seem to have no etiquette about how to setup challenges (I've not noticed a board to put your name on, etc).

The beers are fantastic and relatively well priced. I always walk a bit wavier than usual when I leave here. I've also been in on my way home just to get a quiet beer alone.

I've yet to eat here, but people I know like it!
author: mike o.

description:
hand in hand and with smiles on our faces, my girl and i stepped from the sunshine and songs of chirping birds into the dank darkness of gestalt haus.  a shudder ran down my spine and a chill passed through me, causing me to stop dead in my tracks, as though the tortured souls of purgatory were trying to warn me: turn back, good man, turn back now and take this young virgin with you, out of the further!  (for those of you who don't keep up with contemporary horror films, the further is a horrible place featured in the 2011 classic "insidious", about a family struggling with the haunting of their young son.  but i digress.)   
i'm no hippy, and i almost never talk about "vibes", but listen here: this place had some bad vibes!  
we sat down at the empty bar.  A couple of stoned bartenders, in matching tattoos and beanies, rather than acknowledging my hungry babe and i, chuckled over how high some girl they know was this morning and what a dumbass some other guy is, while we sat staring at each other in disbelief--the only customers in the entire joint!  two people working, and two customers--thats one server for every patron, and yet it was some of the most piss-poor service i've ever recieved.  not only were they slow and aloof, they were actually rude, rolling their eyes when we gave them our drink orders, literally shaking their heads and scoffing when we asked for our sandwiches to go.  the final straw was getting overcharged by several bucks.  the sandwiches were actually decent, but not worth being treated like scum.  be nice for godsakes!  you know, it takes more muscles to frown than it does to SMILE!
author: Skeptical Spee ..

description: Came in one Saturday and watched the Lakers kill the Suns to move onto the finals. The owner, who we got to know, came by and gladly threw us a few beers on the house. The bartenders here are nothing but amazingly cool. Even the German Potato salad kicked ass. Thanks for the great afternoon Gestalt & friends.
author: Champ M.

description:
This place has an excellent selection of German beer ON DRAFT... A German would be impressed at the selection considering it's an American bar... I like it because it doesn't have a Bavarian theme... Picture kind of alternative gothic slightly metal decor found in Hamburg or Berlin. Also bike friendly.

Definitely looking forward to a weissbier mit weisswurst for lunch (Where is the Schneiderweiss vom Fass?)

Standard San Francisco prices at $6 ish.

Also has a delicious selection of west coast brews. Looking forward to food but perfect if you are hankering for a German beer, which should be often.

Oh, also doesn't serve shots, which is good in a way. Could do with some spicy German spirits though...

I actually had this as a 5 just because I am partial to Germany, but since I didn't see a Czech pils, fooseball table, Schneider on tap, and an advertisement on the wall for soccer matches or weisswurst breakfast, I changed to a 4. Bitburger would also be nice!

Great actual German beer glasses!
author: Dave C.

description:
Pool table's a plus. Juke box has some great tunes on it. There's beer coming from the taps and bar stools next to the bar. Other than that, it's like drinking in your broke friend's unfinished basement after a hunting trip. 
Almost forgot about the bike racks... all you Mission hipsters on your fixies will be happy to find a slot for your bike at GH -- One star added, Daten.
author: Marty S.

description:
Come on people it is a no brainer. Finally we have a bar for biker's, messengers & people alike etc. etc.. Personally I like it because of it's down to earth attitude. Nice people in there including the staff; Kevin, Murphy, John & & the lovely monday lady, sorry I forgot your name again, (Claire perhaps)? Anyway I have seen various demographics in there!!

Great Hot Dogs in there by the way :)

Anyway Daniel is the owner from heaven,  because he is also showing some of the best soccer on live TV. Excuse me but I call soccer real football period!!!
Nice sequeway dont you think.

 I'm looking fwd to the Beergarden
Grand Opening

Skaal og ned med dyret 0;-)
author: Steiner A.

description: Myself and about 12 of my colleagues all had lunch here last week. I had the pulled pork sandwich with cheddar and coleslaw. Wow! They also have a great beer selection, a pool table and some great seating areas. It looks like a chill place to have a drink on Friday night.
author: Dustin A.

description:
beer, good
more beer, more good
more beer than more beer, morest gooder. 

so i had three liters. couldve been more if the place wasnt so god damn packed and if there was more than one toilet. 

i wonder if they would get mad if i rode my r6 into here and parked it in the bike rack?
author: Euge L.

description: Haven't been here in ages- looks like a sports bar, now.
author: kathryn a.

description: Cool bar with great beer and a handful of large screen TVs showing the Olympics! The pool table was always busy with people. We got their early enough that we scored a table. Once midnight hit the crowds rolled in. Friend ventured to the restroom and when he came back looked very shocked. Apparently the toilet was backed up and didn't seem like anyone was handling that situation. Huh. I immediately stopped drinking once we made this realization and then bolted.
author: Adriana G.

description:
i always thought when i went to a biker bar it would be all hells angels and shit. leather and beer bellies and maybe someone occasionally getting their ass kicked. no leather in here and i was the only one with a beer belly. well there is a new style of biker bar in my life now. the kind that all those tall lanky bony mo fo's pedal around town and make my driving a sometimes hell. 

liters of cold beer and sausages in one establishment. great idea and i can see now the cholesterol count is going to skyrocket. my Italian link was bursting and flowing with juices so flavorful it was hard to only slide one in. but after 2 liters of beer i get hungry. oh yeah the potato salad rocks too. i will be back very soon.
author: roger b.

description: beer, brats 'n' bikes....catering to city cyclers...indoor bike rack...brat to eat...beer to drink.....$nine liters...a decent pricing.....stout beer selection plentiful....sticking to fat tire brew....countertop electric grill...sizzling of polish sausage....$five meal...toasted bun 'n' sauerkraut...mustard 'n' ketchup....fine brat dining.....
author: Hen A.

description: When i first walked in, i was surprised to see the bike racks, double decker...filled with every kind of bike imaginable... the bar had a good vibe going on, great tunes playing, people playing pool, eating, drinking these massive liters of beer... it made me laugh. I'm more of a vodka drinker and the thought of a liter of beer was hard to swallow...well, until i had one... one was all i needed. It was a deal, $8 for the beer and somewhere around $4 for my bratwurst, $2 for this yummy warm potato salad. I will be going back for sure!
author: Rachel L.

description:
came by to join in the festivities of seeing off norebang/durian loving cutie Steph P on her quest to enlightenment in the midwest... little did i know i would be partaking in a new trend that is all the rage in europe- "the sauna bar."


PROS-
* see girls all hot, sweaty, yeah you get it..
http://www.flickr.com/photos/93334351@N00/1232841504/in/set-72157601651142296/
* detoxification
* nice to have warmth in SF during the summer
* no guilt drinking if you don't exercise

CONS-
* see guys all hot, sweaty, yeah you get it..
http://www.flickr.com/photos/93334351@N00/1231970045/in/set-72157601651142296/
* detoxification
* enhanced body aroma
* WARM BEER

fantastic variety of beer flavors and sizes available and was great to see all the wonderful yelpers come out and party with Steph going bye-bye AND to my surprise seeing Kate K on her return from Ohio.
http://www.flickr.com/photos/93334351@N00/1231977097/in/set-72157601651142296/
a bitter-sweet experience.  

if they fix the AC here i will happily return and order a liter rather than a pint =)  all pics taken by the sexy Eric W (okay you happy now??!!!)
author: omar b.

description: I have a weak spot in my heart for Kronenburg.  I developed a weak spot in my heart for vegan sausage (I'm a carnivore, but those things were great!).  I wish I were a better cyclist though...I'd feel more comfortable there.
author: ellyk E.

description:
a place that actually runs by liter/half liter????  haha 

only quality beers no generic stuff. grilled sausages! vegan ones.

I'm in!   My favorite beer spot in SF.  Everything is legit, the place makes sense. 

Love taking people from out-of-town here, definitely impressive!
author: Laila S.

description:
I went here for the first time last night and had such a great experience. The crowd was mellow, the music varried, they have beer in ungodly huge steins and even have proper German music to accompany the drink.

Add bike racks, a pool table, sausages and sandwiches and you have a great place to go on a Thursday night.

Note that they do not serve hard alcohol, but that is probably part of what keeps this place fairly mellow despite the locale.

I am taking a minute to dedicate a paragraph of my review to the bartender here. He told me his name, so I could properly yelp him, but I warned him I was drinking and would likely forget...which I have. I did say I would just describe him as the cute guy with the dark hair, so if you see him you'll know who I am talking about. When I first ordered our beer the keg blew halfway through the first pint. He gave us that half a beer to tide us over and said come back in 3 minutes. I did, and by the time I came back there were two beautiful, frosty beers waiting for me....that is service!! He also gave us money for the jukebox to pick songs to have singalongs to (after we were belting out Guns and Roses rather loudly and obnoxiously). Clearly he doesnt mind people having a good time at this bar. He let us taste some beers and engaged us in conversation and was integral in making our experience as awesome as it was.
author: Drue C.

description: I've been coming here for years and always have appreciated the selection on tap and the late night vegan sausages.  Recently in the last year or so they have added a full sandwich menu that goes until 8pm now.  I have to say the vegan tuna melt sandwich is amazing.  I usually have them throw cherry peppers in for some spice and it makes it perfect.  I also have brought friends who are meat eaters and vegetarians and they have all found something they truly enjoyed off the menu.  If you like beer, sausages, or vegan options you're in for a treat.  Service has always been good even when the bartender has to multitask between sandwiches and pours.
author: Patrick H.

description: omg! I think i'm in love....but it's all bittersweet! How I miss cafe la onda but it's replacement is something I can definitely live with! Can I tell you...how I love beer and sausages! The german in me is ready to polka up a storm. This place has bike parking within it's establishment, a pool table, beer, and sausages!  Guter laden hier!
author: Paola W.

description: Dive bar with good selection of beers at reasonable prices, but not liquors.  Pretty standard dive bar.   The comfy chairs on the side are nice too.  Seems like a reasonable watering hole to come chill at.
author: William C.

description:
when cafe la onda closed two months back, i spiralled into a major depression.  not only did i have a lot of life all happening at once, but my evening safe haven for writing and ruminating was snatched untimely from me.

for weeks, whenever i walked this stretch of valencia, i bit my lip, scrunched my eyes shut, and sped past, not daring to look what loathsome trespasser had uprooted my dear la onda.

only recently did i notice that in its place had opened a mission interpretation of a german bierhalle.  now, those who know me know that i looooooove me some sausage (especially sausage with sauerkraut).  it's troubled me for some months that i live so faraway from dittmer's (not that i would ever consider living in mountain view, but my distance from sausage heaven is cause for concern).  even rosamunde's a tad to close for regular comfort.  

however, now at my doorstep, is this gem of a little bar--i can get all the sausage and sauerkraut i need, edelweiss on tap, and my fill of the kickassrockinsuperfuckinrad music that once made cafe la onda so near and dear to my heart.  moreover, if i had a bicycle, i could keep it on the indoor bike rack (a quirky but pretty random concept).
author: Roshni R.

description:
Gestalt is a great, new bar and I am biased because they have an indoor bike rack for around 20 something bikes, and they have great beers on tap. Seasonal brews of Sierra Nevada, PBR to bottles of Guiness Nitro! You can ride your bike to the bar and not sweat it disappearing outside.

Jukebox plays great tunes and there is a pool table. A great kick it and drink bar in a good neighborhood.
author: David B.

description:
One bathroom.  Both guys and girls wait in line for a change.   Guy in front of me tells me what a Southern gentleman he is for the ten minutes we stand in line together.  I enter the bathroom to find the seat up and his piss in the bowl.  mmm Southern gentleman piss.  

Luckily the beer and sausage make up for it. Mostly.  Except that the beer increases the frequency with which I have to stand in line with Southern gentlemen.
author: Brooke G.

description: There is something awesome about the simplicity of this bar. They are only wine and beer but the selection is fantastic. They are the only bar I've found that has the Speakeasy Double Daddy on tap as well as many other great beers. They also serve a variety of sausages. These are very tasty and go quite well with beer. It can be kind of hard to get a seat but it is well worth it even if you have to wait a little while.
author: John M.

description: This place is FUN! Great bartenders and cool mission/San Franciscan vibe. Right in the heart of it all on 16th street. This bar should definitely be on your list if you're doing a bar crawl in this area. Wide selection of good beers too.
author: Janie Y.

description: Vegan sausages!!  And great beer!!!  And ladies night!!!  I'm sold.  "Zeitgeist lite" my ass.
author: Renee D.

description:
beer, brats and bikes!

i thought brats was a new term for hipsters, until i went inside and saw all that sweaty sausage (yeah, there were a lot of dudes who had just peddaled in). as a vegetarian the combination of dead animals on the walls and the grill was a bit much, but the fact that they have the best bike-storage of any bar in the city and my ALL TIME favorite beer (or perhaps I was really thirsty?)-- I have to go back to remember it. Just try the red label that's on tap.

but yeah, there were a lot of weenies here: -1 star but i imagine it's a good place to go when you need the hair of the dog. very dark.
author: Chelsea B.

description: Good bar for a Saturday night. It wasn't crowded at all but there were still a few people roaming around...maybe it was just a relatively slow night because it was Valentine's Day? Music was good albeit a little loud, and I was surprised that they only serve beer and wine ONLY. The bathroom though, I had issues with: no mirror! Obviously only a girl would care about this but still, I want to make sure I don't look sloshed when I'm leaving the WC.
author: Alyssa G.

description:
Whoever decided to sell beer in 64 ounce glasses at this place is a fucking genius. Why go back and forth to the bar when you can set yourself up what amounts to a bucket of beer and go to town?

Somehow, the presence of bike racks in this place seemed a bit disturbing to me. I know the Mission, and SF in general- are full of bicycle riders. But that being said- if you're going to be drinking - you should probably be WALKING - or stumbling as the case may be. It's kinda like a drive through liquor store- great concept but less than admirable execution...

Extra points for the fact that the only source of lighting is white xmas tree lights on the ceiling.  I'll be back!
author: Don K.

description: I always seem to end up here. Honestly, on a weeknight, it's not that bad of place to hang out in. Decent beer on tap and some excellent sausages. And the mish mash crappy wooden tables to slam your big, heavy, glass mug onto appeals to me on a very basic level. The jukebox seems to always be playing Van Halen, which is a bonus and it never takes that long to get a drink. Honestly, though. I never seem to get the crowd in here. Sometimes it's cool and chill, other times it's downright annoying. And in a city where real estate rules, do we need a giant bicycle rack in one corner of the bar? I guess there are worse bars out there...
author: Michael E.

description: oh Gestalt, i love you, with your giant cheap beers, your bicycle racks, you slightly too loud music, and the vegan bratwurst covered in special sauce and sauerkraut. This is the bar you will most likely find me if the weather isn't good enough for zeigiest or my pockets are not deep enough for  La Trappe.
author: Jared Z.

description: Maybe a little pricey for mission...5$ beers, but all worth it. Great sausage  , nice bartender, chill atmosphere. Cool art in the restroom. people who complain about the restroom, have you been to other restrooms around mission? yeah... this place is way more cleaner.
author: anna p.

description:
so i think the equation goes something like this:
toronado + rosamunde + zeitgeist = gestalt haus.

only with daaamn good german potato salad, served HOT and with bacon, brats (meaty and vegan) piled high with sauerkraut ... fine selection o' beers on tap if you want it, but ginger or root beer if you don't.

our bartender was almost unusually friendly and chipper for being a bartender, but then there was this one dude that lost his shit when no one came to claim the order: 

(smashes glasses on the floor)
(turns off the music) 

"i said, SAUSAGE UP!" 

i love me a goood bad attitude. 
heh heh, and a good sausage too.

ride your bike there, bitches. they've got racks for it, like the kind in the bicycle store.
author: Winter R.

description: This was the first bar in The Mission that we found with-gasp- open seating after searching on our first Friday night in town. It is a bike kid's dream bar- good quality beer on tap, open room with tables, pool, and an immense indoor bike rack. Everyone seemed friendly, and the bartender recommended a few good beers that I have never heard of before (but then again, my extent of beer knowledge pretty much begins and ends at the bottom of a PBR). Not sure if there was a jukebox or not, but good music played for the duration. I wish we had checked out the veg sausage, but we were burritoed out by the time we found this joint.
author: Tori B.

description: The minute that I walked into Gestalt Haus I thought that I had stepped into a real German bar....from the 1940's.  I was greeted by a militant bouncer forcing my 3 friends and I to show zee paperz.  Apparently our documentation wasn't sufficient so we were then forced to show a second form of ID; so everyone furnished credit cards with names that matched the driver's licenses, which the bouncer said still had "warm lamination."  So my brother & roommate who are both over 21 and my friend who is 30 and I all were rejected from the bar.  So this is a good place to go if you're into LARP and you're looking to reenact the Nazi era, but not a good place to go if you're of legal drinking age and you want a beer.
author: Grant T.

description: cool spot to hang out, have a beer, and watch a game.  The food service is kind of slow, but selection is good for munchie cravings.
author: LT B.

description:
gestalt is an easy go:

veggie love.  vegan sausage outsells meat sausage four to one.  they are good to their vegan customers with two yummy options.  rock.

speaking of rock:  the juke box rules.  nostalgia and rowdiness with the necessary guilty-crowd pleasers.

indoor bike parking.  murphy says to lock my bike, "it is still the mission."  but i pity the fool who tries to lift anything from the racks of this bicycloholic bar.

um, shouldn't it have been first thing i mentioned?  the beer.  i am now weary of those $8 litres, bigger than my head, that have forced me to walk home my aforementioned bike home more than once.  yet, how can i resist the taps of ALL of my favorite beers lined along the bar like bowling pins waiting for me to knock them down?  i can't even pick which one i want first when i get there.  i guess i could buy pints...

the ambiance.  all the walls are painted black, and the ceiling is covered by rows of tiny white xmas lights about 6 inches to two feet apart; that is the only lighting.  decoration is spare, save for deer heads.  there is a pool table, but no chalk board, so better put your quarters on the table.  

pee show.  the bathroom has only one toilet and is unisex, which would suck, if it weren't a private viewing of a fairly decent gallery of the usual sf suspects in the graf game.
author: Kate M.

description: Wonderful to have dedicated off-street bicycle parking, even when I don't ride my bicycle here.  Vegan sausage and beer, mmmm.  I didn't notice the decor at all, because really I was there to have some vegan sausage and beer and just relax...and that's exactly what I did.  Unpretentious bartenders.  Pleasingly chill.
author: Lisa A.

description: I came to this bar and found it oh so much more satisfying than Zeitgeist.  It has a fun, laid-back crowd.  The bartender was friendly and the booze options were perfect.  Also, I recommend the sandwiches - yummy!
author: Mackenzie O.

description: So i walked in here one night with two of my roommates, went to the bathroom and walked back out again. I don't like people in spandex while I'm drinking, I have a hard enough time keeping my drinks down as it is.
author: Constance C.

description: Hands down, game over, move out the way, best bar in the mission kind of spot.  From the Steins, to the brauts, to the jukebox, to the bike parking inside, to the soft cushioned chairs window seating, to the bartender Gabe, to the location...this place is on point.  Only complaint is that the taxidermy could use a bit of an upgrade.  Hit me up (the owner) and we could trade some steins for some antelope or buck heads.
author: Curran J.

description: Okay, so I have to admit, I drink here every day now. It started casually, new bar, good beer, cool staff. Now it is like my extended living room. I stop in on my way home in the evening, and on my way out on the weekend. The beers are amazing, and you can get a pint, 1/2 liter or a full liter - yup, entire liter just for you. I've actually seen a few people require two hands just to get the first sip up. And, to top it off everyone who works there is super cool. Bring your bike and you can put it on the rack inside. And as if you needed more, they have amazing German Bratwurst. You won't leave hungry, thirsty or lonely!
author: Chris G.

description: liter glasses of beer are a definite plus, even though they don't have the right beer for my snobby brew drinkin ass yet. bike racks are pretty cool, but I'm still in the habit of leaving my old beater out in the cold since no one would want it anyway. always love seeing a lot of the same people that tend to frequent here almost on a nightly basis. the owner is damn cool too, and obviously a bike nerd / activist.
author: Coffee ..

description: The cool kids, the people who want to make fun of the cool kids, and the kids out to cop the cream of the cool kid crop are all here, bikes hanging out (they used to have racks, but now have space for some nice couches), beer and liquor flowing like water, discussion tables, and a billiard table all add to the great ambiance that feels like a dive, but with a touch of class. Definitely the bar of The City!
author: Haz O.

description: Good beer selection, but its way too bright in here for a bar.  Seriously, if I wanted to see what people really looked like, I wouldn't be drinking
author: Steve S.

description: $3 for a pint of German pilsner beer on tap from Radelberger on Fridays. 'nuff said.
author: David P.

description:
cool selection of beers....now 20 taps!!!

update:

have yet to try the sausages, but I've heard great things. the bartenders are super friends and i love the owners. :-) too bad about the Edelweiss beer...that too was one of my faves.

update 2:

the veggie sausages are ok. I'll eat 'em if i'm hungry. the beer selection is just too good though. you can get a 1/2 liter for 5-6 bucks!
author: Anita C.

description:
I don't want to admit even knowing this place exists, it killed the last independent cafe that I remember from high-school: when the Red man still roamed the night and the Elbo Room played something other than hippie beat.  Still, I have actually patronized this place and actually enjoyed myself.  Yes, it feels like a transparent marketing ploy aimed cynically at the "Fixxee kid" subculture.  Roll up your jeans, be snobby about your artfully distressed vintage track bike (or $4,000 brand new track bike that you can't repair yourself), grow an ugly but very ironic mustache -- and you to can spring full blown into "hipness", just like Gestalt.

Yet despite skewering San Francisco's pretensions of subcultural authenticity (by revealing these pretensions ultimate hollowness) they have good beer, the staff is nice, there are comfy lounge chairs, and most importantly sausages.  If I can get over my consumer anxiety I will be back, because sausages and beer fill a niche that needs filling along 16th.  I went early when this den was almost empty, and I'm sure it gets unbearable as the evening grinds on. [Actually as of the end of August 2007, this is the only bar with a local, friendly and non-leghumping crowd on weekend nights along 16th -- well there's also the uptown, but I'm not ready to share that]  Also, as to the existence of Zeitgeist. Yes they have a better BBQ [ with a grill etc.] and outdoor seating - they also have more posturing attitude and seem to require (at least from me) a several hour time commitment, Gestalt thus is likely better  for the sausage on the go.
author: Gustie L.

description: Good place to relax, nice lounge-ish area with a fancy light is the first thing i noticed. also a fancy pool table. It's really nice. Good beers, lots of bike space, and its 2 blocks away from the 16th and mission bart station. not so crowded like delurium can be which gets old. beers will run you though. they have some nice taste. Id go back.
author: Kevin M.

description: Me and my boyfriend stumbled across this place while wandering around the mission the other night and it was a really nice surprise. We came in around 11 and the place was relatively uncrowded which was nice cause there were plenty of places to site and relax with one of the many beers they have on tap. The atmosphere was relaxed and unpretentious and the bartender was pretty friendly too. Good beer, good tunes,  good bar. Maybe next time we will try one of the many sausages they have for snacking. (vegetarian for me)
author: Sarah F.

description: So I finally braved the vegan brats here. I was worried they would cause some serious gastric upset as so many veggie alternatives can. but lo and behold, IT WAS DELICIOUS! They have a great beer selection too ( I love the big daddy, go figure), good juke, and a super sweet bartender. We went to check out the new "ladies night" on wednesdays (not many ladies, but it was opening night for that), hopefully if will take off!
author: Eva L.

description: Great place, good snausages, love the liter's of beer, bikes racks inside!!! friendly bartenders....they are onto something here...but they really really need to get better music on the ol' jukebox...
author: Dave R.

description: Great brats beer and free love for my vegan friends.
author: Ivan S.

description: Best bar in the city.   The pool table is located perfectly (don't have to ask people to move every turn).  Awesome change of pace in the beer selection.
author: Jennifer R.

description:
how hard can it be to love this place?

indoor bike parking - check
vegan sausage - check
beer by the liter - double check
they play a lot of metal on the jukebox - scream for me hammersmith!

this place can randomly get super crowded, but even then it is still a good time.  they only server beer and wine, so you never get stuck behind someone trying to order a cosmo or some drink that has 45 steps to it...just belly up to the bar and get  your liter on, son.  the vegan sausages come out pretty fast, and they will pile the fixins on there for you, and the community style seating always insures you will meet someone new.

see you there.
author: matt d.

description: Great sandwiches (I love "The Bird"), never boring beer selection, very friendly staff, and a big screen comes out for sporting events (including soccer!). Much love!
author: Dmitriy S.

description: The bar gets 4 stars, the bartender gets 1. He is a complete ahole and doesn't matter how nice you are to him, he is a complete d**k to you. The problem is he is always there- at least every time I go there- so I try to sit in their couch area instead of the bar. If you can do that, yea it's a nice place to go and much better priced than monk's kettle that is super expensive, but hey they have a really nice selection of belgian beers.
author: Lo F.

description: No frills.  It reminds me so much of a hip version of this bar I used to go to in college (paint everything black!  put up holiday lights!).  The concept drew me in: beer, brats and bikes.  But I have to say that the biggie bike rack wastes a lot of space that could be used for seating.  The smell of brats had my tummy a rumblin'.  If I return, I am getting one for sure.   Another place with excellent beers on tap i.e. Speakeasy Black.  Rock on.
author: T-Bone L.

description: The bartender knew his stuff... gave us in depth info about the beers and even little taste tests. The jukebox is good. The deerheads are strange, but I'm pro taxidermy.
author: Angel S.

description: I love this place.  Recently had a birthday there.  A lot of my friends hadn't been there before and everyone seemed to enjoy the atmosphere.  Good sausage, huge beer steins, and great service.
author: Jeff S.

description: This place is trying too hard.  Nothing special.  There are better options in the neighborhood-- Kilowatt, Delerium... or just walk the extra 2 blocks to the real deal Zeitgeist.
author: Amy S.

description: Went here with a bunch of my friends for an end of school party. (We are psychology students so we thought Gestalt would be fun/funny...) The bartender was a total jerk and basically pushed this old woman on the floor--granted she was a mentally ill homeless woman that probably went in there quite often to bother the patrons--but nevertheless, no one deserves to be pushed around. She was sitting on the floor with no pants on, so two of my friends went and helped her up and walked her outside. Bartender got mad about that and said they had to LEAVE the bar for HELPING her. WTF?! How does this even make sense? He proceeded to push my friend across the room and throw beer in his face. As we were exiting he said something to the effect of: "I hate all you of and I am glad you are leaving" (with expletives thrown in). Hipster angst? I don't know...All I know is that I will never go back there. Also, they ran out of vegan sausages. :P
author: Tiffany P.

description: Gestalt Haus has reinforced my belief that every bar should also serve food.  At five bucks a pop, their sausages are a nice snack (i love how they come with a lot of sauerkraut) and great complement to your beer.  This bar has a huge beer selection, parking space for your bike, and a typical Mission crowd of mostly white hipsters in little pants with their fixies.  I rock some tight pants too (ahem, saggy & tapered a la diesel and the urban outfitters men's section, to be more specific) but would appreciate more racial diversity here -- but I guess you can't have everything.  We come here a lot for our beer nightcaps.  Eva also seems to have an insatiable appetite for their brats.
author: Sid D.

description: Liter steins of good german beer, an unpretentious setting, and a lively crowd.  There's a pool table, a number of bench tables, and a convenient bar.  I can't give the 5th star without trying the food, but the bar experience was great.
author: Jay M.

description: It's the first time I was recognized by three people (who would usually ignore me on the streets when sober) even before I step into the bar. It felt like I was in an episode of Cheers only with more bikes and vegan bratwursts.
author: wendy p.

description:
i like beer. oh, how i like beer. it is therefore pretty hard to knock a place that has an excellent selection of said beverage. 

i found it to be pretty amusing to watch a girl eating a vegan sausage while sitting directly beneath a pair of antlers hanging on the wall. i know the crowds that are attracted to the 16th and valencia bar circuit are all about displaying their sense of irony, but c'mon...
author: Kayla K.

description: A great place to go wind down after a crazy night of riding alongside Critical Mass, there's plenty of room to put your bike, bulbous hat and cardboard sign with some cleverly cryptic progressive slogan.  But the BEST part is that you can find plenty of sausage and beer and beer and sausage and sausage and beer....
author: Jennifer K.

description:
so i've been here already three times, no, four times since they've opened so i don't have to mention that i'll be there again soon. it's true, any bike catered bar will get me in. the whole bike racks inside is great, seeing how our whips can get stolen out front at any time.

the bartenders there have been nothing but nice and have even let me sample a beer before i choose the one of my liking.

loving it!
author: David F.

description: I heard "sausage and beer" and, hey, I was there.  They have a bit of distance to go for my precious fourth star, though.  Like condiments.  If you're gonna have chipotle sausage, or feta sausage, give us options beyond sauerkraut and mustard.  And when I went, they were out of ALL wheat beers.  Sausage and wheat beer are to me what PB&J are to most other folks.  I'd go back, though.  Because I loooooove sausage.
author: Polly Enmity P.

description: good beer selection. went with ramit , susan , alex and a few others.
author: Noah K.

description:
i'm all about experiencing things that are familiar to me in strange quantities.  liters of beer, ounces of milk, gallons of jello...

too much?
author: Mooni P.

description: They have good beers, and if it's not crowded it's an ok place to eat for six bucks. Crowd is on the younger side.
author: Julian M.

description:
It's not just the reasonable price on beer and brats. It's the atmosphere created bartenders who genuinely appreciate each tip and don't mind when young bike messengers don't have a buck to spare.

All are welcome. You can get a sausage anytime and you should. I didn't mean to sound sexual right there.
author: Asdf A.

description:
although no one really admits it, we all like going to popular joints. sure, the occasional hole-in-the-wall, dive bar, or neighborhood joint are godsends, but it's the popular places where we go to see and be scene, err.. seen. gestalt is, for some reason, one of those popular places. yeah, it's got good beers, indoor bikes racks, a pool table, and supposedly good food which i've never eaten. i did love the liters of beer, it made my german heritage proud.

but the same elements that make up this bar also bring it down. the tables in gestalt are more suitable for a restaurant, not a bar. i felt that if i wasn't eating, i shouldn't be sitting down. and the pool table takes up all the standing space, so if people are playing you constantly have to move out of their way. as much as pool tables belong in a bar, i am adamant that they only belong in pool hall bars, not one like gestalt. it is also cash-only. last time i checked, according to the visa commercials, everyone accepts visa and cash only slows you down. can we hurry up and move on up to the current age with accepting forms of currency? please?

i do like that the bar caters to bikers. it doesn't really matter if you have one, or thirty gears, but it's rad that they have a few racks to slap your bike on and feel more safe with.

this wouldn't be a good review of a bar in the mission without using the following word, so here goes: "hipster".
author: Jeremiah W.

description:
I've been quietly procrastinating the writing of this review for...well, when was November?  I can hardly remember those 8 months thanks to Gestalt Haus.  But I don't even call it Gestalt anymore.  My friends and I just call it the bar.  

To be real, I've got a lot of bias behind those five stars, but I'm also a very 'observant' and 'detail-oriented' woman.  (Is this a resume?)  

I don't like hipsters, and I sure don't like fixie heads.  But sometimes I dress like one, and Murphy sold me an apparently pretty sweet fucking road bike a couple months ago.  I ride it.  A lot.  And I'm friends with many of these fixie riders.  So I'm also a hypocrite, but that keeps life interesting.  And so does this bar.  

For example:  You never know if the lock on the bathroom door will be fixed that night or totally busted.  You never know when suddenly the juke has some new shit (that I've never heard of/love/hate).  You never know if some Marina imports will come in and trip on the sinking floorboards, or when the place will reek of sweaty, unwashed biker hipsters.  You never know when they'll re-felt the pool table (as they did last week).  

Then there's also the givens:  You know that every night the beer will taste so fucking delicious and that you could try something new and learn more about beer.  You know that the potato salad will warm your belly and make you want to marry bacon.  You know that John will yell Stella at least once.  You know you'll dance/interpretive dance/sing your face off to Smooth Criminal and Bohemian Rhapsody.  You know you'll make a new friend or check someone out.  You know you'll learn something about road bikes.  You know Kev will take breaks at Double Dutch.  You know you'll play a round of pool with people who are really good and people who suck balls.  You know you'll have more pints, half-liters and liters than you said you would before you walked in.  You know you'll roll your eyes at someone who is too lazy or too cool to put their bike up, or is so cool that they can balance on their fixie no hands for minutes.  You know Murph will slap his arm to exemplify his need for speed and love for bikes.  

I wished the bar stools were taller, but I got used to it.  I worried about the leaking and running toilet, but then sometimes I'd fix it.  I got used to the too-bright xmas lighting, and now I'm used to the perfectly dim xmas lighting that Murph and Kev rigged.  I've developed a love for taxidermy and have increased my knowledge of such.  I've learned about the art of running a business.  I've ignored the gross things.  I've wished for different tunes, but then some new things have come in and I've learned new music.  

I've slept here, blacked out here, puked, pissed, definitely shit here, danced, cried, yelled, laughed.  I've even gotten my dad shit faced here.  Mostly I've just had the fucking time of my life.  Who said college was the best time?  We were dubbed mascots.  It's a good relationship, and a good bar.  

It's not trying to be perfect.  It wants to make you have fun, relax, learn stuff about beer, hang out, and not worry about getting kicked out if you make a mess of your coaster, brat, or beer.  And as it succeeds at those things, it IS perfect.

And they DO do take-out of brats and potato salad, though so far the majority thinks they don't.
author: Loren R.

description: went here for a beer and a sausage. dive bar look, but it was poppin inside. 2 flat screens, pool table, a couple video games, jukebox. good beer on tap, young crowd, and good sausage for a bar. i had the louisiana hot link. it was a juicy beef and pork and their spiciest variety served in a hot dog bun and sourkraut on top. very satisfying for a quick snack and not at all overly spicy, just the right amount especially when paired with an ice cold brew. nice chilll little find
author: Eugene H.

description: This place is freaking awesome.  They got parking for my bike, they have gourmet sausages and HUGE litre beers.  I love it.
author: Matt N.

description: What a cool place!  Numerous bikes locked up outside and numerous bikes in the bike parking as you enter the bar.  How cool!  Great, laid-back atmosphere and service was fast.  Good beer selection, the brats were delicious, and everything was very reasonably priced.
author: John C.

description: If it was their goal to make a dive bar with Guinness and and weird sandwiches then they have succeeded!  There's pinball and pool *and* questionable furniture! I'm going back!
author: Jeremy L.

description: My favorite neighborhood bar.  Hannah and Austin make some of the best sandwiches in town - all homemade quality ingredients.  About 20 beers on tap, pool, pinball, big screen, great location.
author: J O.

description: I'm not a beer or sausage fan, so you can stop reading my bias review now.  I end up here often because I have a number of friends who ride bikes and drink beer.  It's usually unnecessarily loud, because someone is "DJing" and I'm not a fan of playing pool in a place where every shot you make you have to ask people to move.  The bartender is friendly-- even though I drink soda water-- and I never have a necessarily bad time here.
author: Jessica T.

description: Yeahhhhh what ever, the new owner isn't german and dosn't care about anything the old owners stood for. the old owners have taken the gestalt to marin and they are worthy of the name they created. so get with it and go back to what made the place great swinehultz. there is rumer that since the new owner messed up the old place there will be another in SF. keep your eye glued to the road and your hearts to a new gestalt in SF.
author: billy m.

description: I was prepared to hate this place, as a kiddie zeitgeist, but it was relaxed, I got a cushy chair to sit on, and my vegan sausage was good.
author: Amy E.

description: My favorite place in the city to just chill out with some friends and beers. Usually not too crowded, and the bartenders are friendly and give good recommendations. The sausages aren't anything to write home about but they're good for washing down a liter of beer.
author: Andy S.

description: Surprisingly great sausages! The beer is pretty tasty too, but the sausages are definitely better than the bacon dog cart usually found down the street...
author: Nicolas H.

description: Sometimes, life is just made of simple pleasures: Fat Tire, billiards, and a bicycle, all of which are part of the essence of Gestalt. A cozy chillout spot moments away from the chaos down the street.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Great beers by the liter AND sausages? What more can you ask for you say? How about a bartender whose response to the order of, "Can I get two Bud Lights?" is " Sorry, can I help you?" Classic.
author: sholeh m.

description:
great sausages, great location, great beer...why three stars....often out of food early.....if you are running out of food before 8 in the mission, plan ahead and have more food, because when i arrive and am told there is nothing left i am bummed, esp if i have brought newbies and talked it up and then am "letdown". 
only other issue.....the single coed bathroom is awful...... the hush hush back in the day of pbr and sinks with holes in them and portopots are the only bathrooms i have ever seen that are worse....still so much to love, a bar with it's own personality on the main drag
author: Adrienne G.

description: i like this bar. im just writing a review so its easier for me to bookmark in my profile. Get the liter steins!
author: Michael N.

description:
OK dive bar.  Had alot of fun.  The antlers on the wall kind of reminds me of the Argus' cattle skulls on the wall.  I didn't try the Brats but that and the liters of beer help to sell the name of the place.  

I had 2 liters of beer.  I could have kept drinking but I couldn't keep lifting.  Those mugs are fucking heavy.  

I saw some familiar faces.  These yelpers have pretty good b.s.  Got pressure to be official so here I am.  Lazy ole' took 5 minutes out of my office space job to sign up.  I'm a new recruit!
author: Daniel K.

description: Good beer.  Great sausage.  Love the big game/cyclist decor.  Not too crowded and not too cool for school that a table full of science geeks feels unwelcome.
author: Monkeyfaced E.

description:
ooohhh gestalt. 

i will always remember my first experience here. it was a quiet monday night and i was enjoying my beer with my best friend. I noticed that some cracked out homeless guy walked into the bar lookin for trouble. I ignored him and continued with the beer and the talkin and the next thing i know that same dudes head is being slammed into the wall by the bartender!!!! the bartender did this about 5 good times and the dude fell to the floor leaving blood on the wall! some random person ran up to help the bartender pick the dude up and told the dude to never come back. it seemed like shit like that goes down all the time because less than 2 minutes later, the blood from the wall was gone and people went back to what they were doing.  

HUH.........i know i was blown away by that.

after that night nothing like that has occured...THANKFULLY! all the other times ive been here it's always chill....besides the line to get into the bathroom. dont they know they should have TWO bathrooms. sometimes being a guy is easier, just go outside to the alley and wa-la!
author: Tedi O.

description: Flat black walls, deer skulls and liters of prohibtion? Not too shabby. I wish we had one in Oakland.
author: Ben L.

description: stopped in a for a beer with some friends yesterday.  gestalt has a nice beer selection and i liked the beers we tried: weihenstephan hefe dunkel (a dark wheat beer that was delicious!) and twist of fate (english style bitter ale). i also liked the laid back feel of the place and the three stools by the sunny window were good for a summer afternoon.  didn't try the sandwiches, but the menu seemed good (and they use boar's head, which is a plus).  i'd go back.
author: micaela r.

description: Stars for the beers only.  This place would rate higher if the lights were a little lower and the sausages were good.  They have two brats on the menu so I asked the bartender for the better of the two and he served the Bavarian, and it was flavorless.  I am glad I didn't try the other plain brat, because it must have tasted like caca.  Great place for brews, but I would expect a better brat from a German beer hall.  I understand the Cajun chicken sausage is good, but come on I am in a German beer hall I want a decent brat!
author: Mickey D.

description:
It's on my way home from work. It's on my way home from school. It's (basically) on my way from my kitchen to my bedroom(give or take a few blocks).
But even if it wasn't I'd still stop by for a hey-hello.  Much love for Murphy, Gabriel, and all those other fellows who provide friendliness and kindness(read:beer).  Excellent beer selection, tasty vegan brats, bitchin' juke, and the bike rack inside couldn't be a better idea.

I can always count on this place for comfort(read:beer) and friendly familiar faces.

Just watch out for those weekends when the whole Marina district decides they want to hang out.
author: Kimi Y.

description:
*** Please note, I welcomed a guest writer on board for this one:
altho i like the house wine and nice bartenders at gestalt, i miss the old coffee shop even  more -- c'est la. ***


Ich Liebe Gestalt!
Big beers for cheap, low key, Bike racks! Lots of cheese on the jukebox. 
Nice Bartender; not above conversing with the clientele. 
Not quite Moes, just a little dark and dank. Ah, but the Dank...
Generally Not the Gucci crowd. 
As a former Wisconsinite, I respectfully tip my hat to the bread-like staff-of-life German beers and the Bratwurst. 
please don't go there; I want the place to myself :)
author: Christina F.

description:
Warning: This bar closes early.

I used to love this place.  Last Thursday night, I enter the bar at 11pm and order a beer.  At 11:15, the bartender shouts, "Last Call!"  I thought it was a joke.  At 11:30pm, he asks everyone to leave and closes the bar.

There were about 30 people in the place at the time.  After someone complained, the bartender stated, "On the weekends, maybe I'll stay open later.  But tonight I have things to do."  Very strange.  There used to be a very cool and laid back owner/bartender/bicyclist that ran this place.  Now it has been taken over by someone who has got better things to do.   Too bad.  It was one of my favorite places in the Mission.
author: Tom R.

description: At first, I didn't know what to make of this place.  I thought I walked in to a bike shop.  The bike racks near the front of the place really threw me a curve, as did some of the patrons that were dressed in bike/messenger shorts.  But then, the placement of the pool table kinda brought it all together.  This was a neighborhood watering hole that welcomed the environmentally conscious to their rustic bar.  Situated on one of the busiest cross-streets in the Mission, Gestalt Haus forte is beer...in what looked to be about 20 different ones on tap.  The difference between any other bar in the Mission and Gestalt seems to be the choice of glasses...pints, half-liter, or 1 liter glasses.  It didn't dawn on me that you could get something larger than a pint until Omid and Ed 'brung' it.  I couldn't even fathom finishing a liter.  So I proceeded to take baby steps...start with a pint, then a half-liter, and then another half-liter.  I didn't make it to the liter, but FWIW, stick with a pint instead of a half-liter.  You're getting more for your money ($0.25 vs $0.296 per oz) with the pint.  The liters do make it look like you're at Oktoberfest, but if you don't drink fast, the beer does get warm.  It's nicer to have a cold fresh one at hand.  Also not to be missed, their selection of organic sausage sandwiches.  A good alternative if you're not bacon dog cart friendly.  This place did take a while before the crowds started to filter in, but once they did, it did get noisy.  Definitely a cool stop to lounge in the Mission.
author: JeFF T.

description: this is my favorite place to end a long day of riding my bike to golden gate park lounging in the sun and then riding back to sit in an armed chair, eat a sausage and drink a big beer while watching my sun kissed friends play pool.
author: Ameigh F.

description: I still have the sh..tz two days after eating a sausage and the potato salad from this place. I should have known better ... I kept walking into disaster, ignoring the warning signs. I miss good German food. Suppenkuche is fine, Schroeder's is less than desirable, Walzwerk is ok, Schmidt's is limited. I just wanted to try another German restaurant. So I did a google search for German food San Francisco, and this place popped up. It's around the corner ... so I thought I'd give it a shot, & the reviews about the sausages were pretty good. I think people must have has a few liters of beer before writing the good reviews. This place is a bar ... not a restaurant. I ignored that warning sign. The guy who helped me, and eventually prepared my sausage, had had a few too many beers. I ignored that warning sign. He didn't look too clean. I ignored that warning sign. I almost did not go thru with the order. But, I thought ... ahhh, we're kinda of germ-a-phobes to a ridiculous level ... I'm sure it'll be fine; besides this just might be a new find, right around the corner from my house. I felt nauseous within an hour. Then the diarrhea started & hasn't stopped for two days.
author: dan b.

description: Gestalt was our last stop on a day-long bike tour of Mission bars. And what a truly killer way to finish up an already happy day. The bartender was great, the crowd was friendly, the beer selection was very good, the sausages were yummy and the bar was dark and cozy, just the way we like it. I didn't really register the jukebox as we were pretty toasted and imbued in an intense conversation that verged on an argument about the standards used by the  BJCP (beer judging certification program)  for judging beer. Regardless, there will be many repeat visits to this lovely little dive.
author: Sage R.

description: Went here for a Gold Bar Wednesday fundraiser to support a friends worthy cause. Casual, tasty beers, brats, pool table, decent amount of space, great location, nice folks, good times. Thanks Gestalt!
author: Brendan L.

description: we stumbled upon this bar last sat, well after a few hours at Zeitgeist (much to the solitary bar man's dismay, Im sure - especially when we played Michael Jackson on the jukebox). We had ourselves a tasty sausage and beers!! Im so happy they're here!
author: Inome C.

description: too many fixed gears, not enough trail bikes. oh i forgot my blackblock sweatshirt and cord-cutoffs. shit. best head down to delerium where i won't get stared at. derailleurs & knobbies topple all of you!
author: ultra p.

description: When I was younger, rode my bike, didn't shower as much as I should've, and, wore the same jeans for days, I'm sure I would've given this place four stars at least, if not five.  Now, I don't ride my bike that much, I definitely shower like I should, and, I change my pants frequently. I guess three is what they get from me. The clientele here is made up of all the USUAL SUSPECTS you'd find on 16th St. in the mission. Guy with skinny jeans who pulled his clothes out from the dirty clothes hamper, his equally stinky chick with horizontally striped shirt and some hi-liter yellow high heels, the dude who has pierced his face into oblivion cuz daddy just couldn't say " I Love You", and, the VEGAN NAZIS who obviously love the texture of meat but don't want to do what it takes to get it. PU$$IES. Anyway, you should go here if you don't feel like going to the lower Haight to get a Brat from Rosamunde and eat it at the Toronado. I would suggest you do the latter first.
author: santiago g.

description: I like it because I'm a beer fan and they have sausages. Bonus points if you like bikes/soccer.
author: Post R.

description: lots of different types of beer on tap that you can get in all different sizes, like a liter that's as big as my head! and a boot! a boot, people! so cool. plus really good, tasty links, sausages and dogs, and nice bartenders. oh and they top the dogs off with a big pile of sauerkraut if you want. yes, please! the more kraut, the better! two thumbs up for sure.
author: amy W.

description: Nice bar, it used to be a "messenger bar" but now it's mostly a "lesbian bar" it's still a good spot though if you like dark beer or soju.
author: Henry C.

description: good beer selection, good location, lots of meats-wrapped-in-intestine (and some veggie stuff, allegedly).  crowded, loud, and the absolute definition of SF-hipster hell.  only in the inner recesses of williamsburg (now greenpoint?) is there more ludicrously misguided hip-steez prancing about.  on the positive tip, people-watching is amusing, and they're not quite the militant fixed gear set.
author: Brad S.

description: yum! vegan sausage. bicycles.  pool table.  nice folks behind the bar. jukebox full of all those embarrassing songs you wish you didn't know the words to but will sing along badly anyways at the top of your lungs. and very close to my house.  perfect.
author: amanda d.

description: beer and stationary bike races.....need i say more? :)
author: Steven K.

description:
i used to have the perfect relationship with gestalt. it was my main standby, as i could always ensure that it wouldn't be too crowded, the lights wouldn't be offensive and friends could park their bikes inside.

how i long for the days of yore. gestalt has remade itself into some sort of lounge-y, red-walled, bad-lighting spot. i wanted to like the new gestalt because i'd loved the old one so much, but when they took the bike rack out, gestalt became unrecognizable to me. 

a little part of me is holding out hope that gestalt will realize the folly of its ways, but i suppose that depends on whether they care about losing many loyalists. i, for one, have no desire to go back to this now-nondescript locale.
author: Lisa T.

description: when i am feeling very Portland, I'll go to gestalt. yes, I did say portland. land of beers and bikes and lots o' white folk. and yes, that's what gestalt has - good local beers (that double daddy is yummy!), tasty sausages served on soft buns, not very many colored folk like myself, and LOUD MUSIC. WHAT?!! DID YOU SAY SOMETHING?! yup, about the only thing that really turns me off is the tendency for that volume to be turned up SO HIGH THAT YOU CAN'T HEAR YOURSELF THINK. c'mon now, one does not have to be deaf to be cool and hip. turn down the music, hand me a pint, grill me a lamb sausage and all will be fine.
author: ray e.

description: i dont even ride bikes, but im into this place. i think its good for san francisco. interesting concept
author: Lauren V.

description: i stopped here for my last beer early one friday morning and it was quite a capper for a drunken night.  i'm a fan of good beer and gestalt has it in spades for a reasonable price.  apparently there is some bratwurst lurking somewhere within as well.  looking forward to that.
author: Markus B.

description: They now have a cr@ppy DJ on Saturday nights, who plays his sh!t music just loud enough so you can't hear what anyone else is saying.
author: Tom Z.

description: i love how there is room to breathe in this place and there are places to sit.  the people who come here are pretty normal biker/hipsters. i live around the corner and  stop by when i want to chill with a friend.  i haven't taste the sausages yet but they look damn tasty. i love their cheap wine and pool table.
author: Ann M.

description: Went there with recommendation of a friend who commute on bicycle. The place has a rack inside for bicycles, which makes after work social drink very convenient.  The beer has good price, $9 for a very large pitcher.
author: Jonathan L.

description: i like to park my bike here and get WASTED.
author: Matthew T.

description: I agree with all the positive comments, but gotta say that I the jukebox is really pretty mediocre.  They should find someone who actually likes music and have them pick some cds.  Its like they bought them off the sidewalk on the corner.  If not for the jukebox, I'd be drinking there right now.
author: Matt B.

description:
i like the bike rack. i like the sausages. i like the beer. 

that being said, the big ugly fatty baldish bartender is a dick. 
he has never ONCE been nice or taken the time to step out of his self-righteous bartender asshole role to be a be real person to the patrons of the bar. ugh. he's so rude and it makes me upset to even get a beer from him.

the girl bartender is super nice and so is the skinny hipstery looking dude bartender. i don't know where they went wrong with old pigface.

moral of the story is, 
the place is worth going to if you don't mind an attitude problem from mister no personality mean pants.
author: otto v.

description: checked out this bar last week when they were hosting Gold Bar Wednesdays (a group that organizes fundraisers at a different bar every 2 wks) i'd never even heard of or seen this bar before, and it was great! casual, chill, pool tables and delicious, inexpensive food. i got a yummy pastrami & swiss sandwich for $6 that came out in 5 minutes. great beer selection, fast & friendly service, nice place to hang out and grab a beer w/ friends..
author: Julie M.

description: this place rocks.  the bartenders are awesome and the regular hipster crowd is totally cool and not at all intimidating as some other reveiwers have mentioned.  if you aren't a cyclist ask one of them to show you his/her bike and you will be introduced to a whole new world. gestalt has a beer for everyone and decent wine, if beer isn't your thing. and you can never go wrong with the brats - especially late night.  yum.  the decor is basic; the vibe chill and friendly. gestalt is my new favorite hang out in the mission -- tuesdays, thursdays, and fridays are the nights to go.
author: spinstar m.

description: this is one of the first bars that i discovered when i moved to sf. they opened on halloween of 2006..i moved here on 11/2/06. i was immediately drawn to the vegan sausages, dark interior (the walls are painted black and stewn with white christmas lights) and litres of beer for a good price. i have always had a good time there. even when i go by myself a stranger always strikes up a conversation with me. theres always cute boys and if you play pool someone willing to play a game or two. i do advise you to respect the litres...espescially of double daddy. theres been many a time when ive abused them and gotten out of hand. i dont go there as much as i used to but i am always down for a litre and a vegan sausage.
author: shawna s.

description: i will forever miss la onda, and while i promised myself i would continue to walk passed gestalt and never go in....it  has become one of my favorite bars. the brats are good. there are plenty of options for the meat eater, and the non meat eater... and options oh the options of beer. i love beer. i was drawn in originally by the edelweiss which is  no longer available, but  i stay for all of the other beer like hacker pschorr... the thing about this bar is that people tend to be fairly unpretentious and friendly. i think it may have something to do with the lack of hard alcohol, they serve just beer and that suits me just fine. the bartenders are excellent eye candy and are genuinely interested in making sure you have the beer your taste buds have always longed for. especially murphy, he's sweet,  friendly, and knows all the necessaries about beer.  he genuinely enjoys beer and makes you want to learn more about beer as well. the jukebox could use some work but the selection available is pretty good. gestalt is a comfortable,  excellent place to hang out with friends and have a liter of beer. yes a liter. goodness...
author: Alicia M.
